Job Description:
Network Modeling Engineer

ACG Research has developed a unique Business Analytics Engine (BAE) that is
used for business modeling and economic analysis of IT systems that include
networks, data centers, cloud, and edge computing. The primary role of the
Network Modeling Engineer is to use the BAE to work with customers to build
business models. The BAE has a highly intuitive visual interface that creates
economic models by connecting model components. The Network Modeling Engineer
must work closely with ACG’s customers to understand the objectives of the
modeling exercise and understand the dynamics of the systems being modeled.
After understanding the objectives and structure of the model, the engineer
will build the models using the BAE. You must have a strong IT technical
background and also be capable of and interested in constantly learning new
systems, technologies, and architectures. A strong understanding of financial
modeling is a plus but not required since the BAE does most of this analysis
automatically.

 **Job Requirements:**

  * BS degree (or higher) in engineering or computer science
  * 2 years of experience preferably in systems engineering, sales engineering or business development with a vendor or a systems engineering role in a large enterprise or service provider
  * Desire to constantly learn

 **Systems and Technologies:**

Although knowledge and experience in specific technologies is not required,
experience in the following areas would be of great benefit:

  * 5G mobile networks, including RAN, Open RAN, and virtual packet core
  * Private 4G/5G
  * Enterprise networks, including WAN, LAN, and Wi-Fi
  * Virtual edge technologies
  * Network Function Virtualization
  * Data center architectures: computing, storage, and switching
  * Multi-cloud and hybrid cloud
  * Edge computing

  * LDAP/RADIUS integration (SSLVPN, 802.1x WLAN, etc) and troubleshooting

  * Document network problems, resolutions, and updates for future reference

### **About Aston:**

_"Our culture of Innovation, Collaboration, Inspiration and Mentorship is at
the core of our success."_

Aston Technologies has been integrating people with opportunities to learn and
innovate since 2001. Our two decades of excellence have transformed our IT
consulting services into a go-to partner for our clients, with IT projects
nationwide. Aston invests in the latest technologies to empower employees and
instill an innovative culture where learning and career growth are paramount  

  
  

#### **Job Description:**

Aston Technologies is seeking talented individuals that are highly motivated
and eager to launch their career in the IT industry. This role begins with an
on site training program with curriculum designed to test and sharpen your
technical abilities, develop strong professional skills, and familiarize you
on the technologies you will be working with in the field. As a Network
Engineer, you will be working on client network infrastructure and security
projects nationwide to help assess, design, implement, troubleshoot, and
maintain network hardware and software to ensure a successful project
completion.  
  
Upon successful completion of training, you will have a better understanding
in areas like virtual and physical network infrastructure, network security,
application delivery, and cloud network services on a large enterprise scale
on long or short-term job assignments. When on project, network engineers are
expected to solve technical challenges, document solutions, resolve technical
faults, and allocate resources to deliver solutions for the client. We are
looking for people to participate in our in-office and remote training for
this position as soon as May 9th.

  
  

#### **Requirements:**

Must be able to provide proof of vaccination against COVID-19

General understanding of basic computer terminology and a strong passion to
learn

Basic knowledge and proficiency of Windows OS and Microsoft Office Suite

Ability to effectively and professional convey written and oral communication

Must be open to 100% nationwide travel/relocation to client sites (Currently,
travel is limited due to COVID)

Successful completion of a background checks and drug screens

Must own a reliable vehicle for transportation

Ability to drive to Minneapolis

Ability to train on site in our Minneapolis office (Remote hires may be
required to travel to our offices as needed for the position)

  
  

#### **Training Includes:**

Full time (40hrs/week) paid fast-paced training

Corporate housing package and cost of living stipend provided upon request in
lieu of an hourly rate

Professional development in-house: formal skill-based training, preparation
for future projects, and developmental relationships

Collaborative team environment with peers and mentors every step of the way

Hands on access to state-of-the-art technology from our preferred vendors

1-on-1 mentorship with highly skilled Senior Level Engineers to sharpen your
skills

  
  

#### **On Project Perks and Benefits:**

Pay starts at $20/hour after completing our 3-month paid training program

Up to 20% raises at scheduled checkpoints/ merit-based reviews

Excellent Health, Dental, Vision, and 401(k) with employer match program

7 Paid Federal Holidays

Accrue up to 2 weeks PTO annually after first year on project

Certification Reimbursement (example: CCNA, CCNP, PCNSE, AWS)

**Employer-Provided Benefits When Traveling**

Logistics support team to handle all travel coordination

Furnished housing or lodging

Weekly food stipend

Monthly transportation stipend

Title: Sr. Network Engineer Location: Tempe, AZ; Plano, Texas; or remote for
the right person

Your role:

  * Acts as a shift lead during US hours to coordinate incoming incident/issues/changes amongst the team and drive high visibility business-impacting service outages.
  * Identify new opportunities and run PoC/implementation with the rest of the team as part of a technology refresh.
  * Mentor and help other members of a team with relevant technologies and issues as senior resource.
  * Installation, troubleshooting, and management of Network Infrastructure as a part of Global Network Services team.
  * Ownership of low to high priority incidents assigned to Network queue by Service Desk, Users and Monitoring systems until resolution.
  * Implement routine changes such as OS upgrades, routing, ACL/Firewall rule updates, and project-related changes such as installation and configuration of new devices, ISP circuits, S2S VPN, etc.
  * Effectively collaborate with Vendors, ISPs, and other cross-functional teams to drive incidents and changes while following ITSM best practices and SLAs.
  * Identify automation opportunities and automate regular network functions via code.
  * Update diagrams, documentation, policies, and procedures to keep SoPs up to date.
  * Part of a Global team providing 24/5 support with rotating on-call over the weekend.

What you’ve got:

  * Campus/WAN/DC Routing & Switching, ACI Fabric (Cisco ISR, CAT, Nexus)
  * NGFW Platforms (Juniper, Cisco, Fortinet)
  * 10+ years of experience in the networking domain
  * Bachelor’s degree in CS/Electronics/IT
  * Relevant certifications on vendor products like Cisco, Juniper, SDWAN, etc.
  * Must have strong networking concepts and experience in Cisco Routing/Switching/Wireless, NGFW, IPS/IDS, DDI platforms
  * Must have hands-on experience on one of the SDWAN platforms such as Versa, Viptela, or Silver Peak
  * Excellent troubleshooting skills and must be able to work effectively within other teams
  * Be open to working on technologies under network portfolio such as Load balancers, NAC, Remote Access VPNs, DDI, and Azure
  * Experience in using common systems logging and monitoring tools such as Splunk and SolarWinds
  * Basic understanding of IP Telephony & Voice Networking concepts
  * Understanding of any of scripting languages (Shell/Python /Perl)
  * Good understanding of ITSM
  * Willing to work during evening hours and weekends as needed to support the business

Good to know skills:

  * SDWAN Technology (Versa, SilverPeak, Viptela)
  * Voice Telephony (Cisco, Avaya)
  * Azure Network Infrastructure Administration
  * Coding/Scripting (Ansible, Python)
  * DNS, DHCP & IPAM (DDI)

Maveris exists to help organizations reach their fullest potential by
providing thought leadership in IT and cyber. We are hiring multiple full-
time, permanent candidates to support our large Federal Government customer in
the architecture and management of their enterprise network. Selected
candidates for this position will be capable of providing leadership in WAN
evaluation and capacity planning and be comfortable communicating to senior
leadership. This is a full time direct position with Maveris.

Candidates will work at a Washington, D.C. or Martinsburg, WV Federal
Government customer location. Relocation assistance is available.

Veterans encouraged to apply.

 **  
Requirements**

 **Experience with some or all the following**

  * Experience in an enterprise environment involving network architecture and management
  * Knowledge and understanding of Network management and application analysis tools is required (NetScout, SolarWinds and OpNet preferred)
  * Experience with router and switch administration (Cisco experience preferred)
  * Understanding of capacity management/planning techniques and processes
  * Knowledge/understanding of carrier circuits to include, but not limited to OC3, DS3, T1, and Ethernet Transport Services.
  * Ability to work across multiple projects; provide written/verbal status updates on each project on a regular basis to the team lead, Program Manager and customer
  * BGP, OSPF, EIGRP knowledge
  * Knowledgeable with MPLS-VPN carrier offerings
  * Knowledgeable of VoIP solutions
  * Ability to interact with executive level staff
  * Desire to learn new technologies and methods of data/voice communications
  * IPv6 knowledge
  * Experience with Riverbed/OpNet software suite

  

  

**Duties Performed**

  * Make architecture recommendations to support the growing needs of the customer based on new application deployments
  * Provide recommendations for enterprise compatibility in the state-of-the-art network design lab
  * Provide on-call escalation support if an issue arises that cannot be rectified by the network operations team
  * Write white papers on new technology and how it will help support the mission of the customer
  * Use existing Network Management tools to provide capacity management/utilization reports

  

  

**Qualifications**

  * Associate's or Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
  * Selected candidate will need to be able to successfully complete and obtain a Tier 4 High Background Investigation
  * Duties may require traveling, being on call periodically, and occasionally working outside normal working hours (evenings and weekends)
  * Certifications: CCNA/CCNP or higher preferred

**Benefits**

Maveris attracts and retains talent of the highest caliber by offering
opportunities to work in exciting and challenging environments surrounded by
bright minds. Our employees are our most prized asset and are rewarded with
highly competitive compensation and a top-tier benefits package, including:

  

  * 401(k) with company contribution
  * Dental Insurance
  * Health Insurance
  * Vision Insurance
  * Life Insurance
  * Paid Time Off

MI Technical Solutions seeks qualified candidates to fill immediate openings
for experienced Network Engineer positions in San Diego and other US Navy
bases.

Who we are: MI Technical Solutions is a Women-Owned Small Business (WOSB)
comprised of a broad range of talented employees that provide diversified
engineering and technical support services since 2004! Our team works
tirelessly to build a respected, results-oriented brand. We are headquartered
in Chesapeake, VA with employees located near each of the Navy Fleet Centers
within the continental United States (San Diego, Jacksonville, Seattle, New
England, Norfolk) as well as Hawaii and Japan.

What you will do: As a Network Engineer on our team, you will work with U. S.
Navy personnel to assist in migrating data to temporary networks built by you.
Our team supports continuity of day-to-day operations while US Navy ships are
undergoing extended periods of maintenance and upgrades. You will communicate
with customers and develop timeline of milestones for each project. During the
project, you will work with technicians and stakeholders to ensure a smooth
transition to a temporary LAN utilized by the customer. While the ship is
operating on the temporary network, you will act as their point of contact for
any network concerns. You will also check in with the customer periodically in
order to maintain a high level of communication, perform health checks on the
system, ensure proper operation, and verify successful data backups.

Additionally, MITS Teams are involved in research and development projects to
include artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML). We primarily
support the US military and routinely partner with institutions of higher
learning. You may be invited to support these endeavors and bring your talents
to strengthen ongoing projects.

What you bring to the Team: Five years Network Engineering and/or System
Administrator with experience in servers, storage devices, writing and editing
configurations of switching and routing equipment. Advanced knowledge of Cisco
products is ideal.

  * U.S. Citizenship is required

  * Hold active clearance or eligible for clearance

  * Bachelor's Degree is preferred, however, no specific discipline is required
  * Perform other duties within this scope as needed with potential to assist Research and Development (R&D) in their endeavors

What you get in return: Benefits include highly competitive pay; Comprehensive
Medical, Dental and Vision insurance; Life and A&D coverage; Disability
coverage; Employee Assistance Programs; 401 (k) Plan with company
contributions; Paid Time Off and all federal holidays paid; Educational
Assistance; Legal Insurance

**NOAA - NWS**

Network Engineer

Honolulu, HI

 ** _GENERAL JOB DESCRIPTION_**

1) Wide Area Network (WAN) Services  
The candidate will manage and provide services as follows:

  * WAN services include the evaluation, design, deployment (installation, configuration, provisioning), testing, monitoring, security, administration and reporting of networks that interconnect two or more separate facilities that span a geographic area larger than a campus or metropolitan area.
  * Transmission facilities services shall include, but are not limited to, dedicated Internet connections, Internet‐based VPNs, MPLS, and dial‐up connections. The contractor shall work with public carriers and other Government circuit providers on behalf of the NWS Pacific Region to ensure delivery of WAN services.
  * Support of any network services‐related work required by designated carriers, to support the NWS Pacific Region network, is considered within the scope of services.

2) Local Area Network (LAN) Services  
The candidate will manage and provide LAN services including the evaluation,
design, deployment (installation, configuration, provisioning), testing,
monitoring, security, administration and reporting of networks that are
usually confined to a single facility or portion of a facility. LAN components
including LANs supporting all network traffic originating from desktop
devices, local file and print servers, application servers, database servers,
peripherals, firewalls/routers, other network devices and other user premise
devices. This service ends at, but does not include, the LAN attached to the
device network card at the desktop.

3) Steady-State Corrective Maintenance  
The candidate will manage and provide Steady-state corrective maintenance that
is performed at unpredictable intervals. The objective of corrective
maintenance is to restore the system to satisfactory operation within the
shortest possible time. Steady-state corrective maintenance consists of the
following action(s):

  * Restore a failed system to operational status. This usually involves replacing or repairing the software or hardware component that is responsible for the failure in the system.
  * Action to make configuration changes or other fixes conducted under a Steady-State Corrective Maintenance Work Request may require application configuration change to implement into production.
  * Action taken to ensure continuing operations for hardware/software version/platform/infrastructure changes (e.g. operating system upgrades) when the impacted business application/system would otherwise not work as a direct result of that version/platform/infrastructure change.

 ** _QUALIFICATIONS FOR THE JOB_**

  * Minimum five (5) years of experience as a network engineer.
  * Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) Certification
  * Experience in planning, procurement, designing, developing, configuring and commissioning federal networks and associated systems for network monitoring and incident management.
  * Experience with Federal Government network documentation and policy design/compliance.
  * Ability to analyze, evaluate and monitor network infrastructure to ensure networks are configured to operate at optimal performance.
  * Expert in troubleshooting and diagnosing network problems, and determining the most appropriate means of resolving problems and issues to improve network performance.
  * Enhanced ability to monitor the overall performance of systems to assess the need for updates, upgrades, enhancements, preventive maintenance and new systems, and recommending options for upgrading and improving the performance of systems.
  * Ability to plan and communicate the steps needed to deliver a defined outcome.
  * Ability to evaluate and document the business case for a defined initiative.
  * Ability to view overall business priorities and redefine own and team’s priorities in line with expectations and objectives.
  * Ability to ensure most urgent and important needs of the business are achieved.
  * Ability to summarize technical information into a format suitable for senior management reporting without losing the essence of the information

 ** _HIGHLY DESIRED SKILLS_**

Environment: The network operates in Linux, Windows and Mac environments.
Network equipment includes but is  
not limited to routers, switches, VPN, remote support, firewalls, and out-of-
band management and wireless infrastructure.

The systems leverage commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) products, and government
off-the-shelf (GOTS) applications (locally developed applications and
corporate applications). This environment supports infrastructure providing
network connectivity to approximately 250 workstations.

We Can Go Fast Forever. We’re building a fast paced team with an emphasis on
iterative development and constant collaboration. We believe pair programming
makes us stronger, faster, and smarter. We practice and teach an approach to
software engineering that applies across industries and organizations, so
you’ll experience all types of teams, products, and technologies. And we
believe that working fast doesn't mean working overtime- taking time to relax,
recharge and refocus keeps our pace sustainable. We Court Perfection. Working
at Kohls means you get better at what you already do well. We set up regular
retrospectives to figure out what we’re doing wrong so we can fix it, and what
we’re doing right so we can improve on it. We consistently practice Test
Driven Development, which results in high-quality, reliable and more
maintainable code. And we believe that methodical, steady, relentless forward
momentum drives consistent results. What we are. A Network Platform Engineer
at Kohl’s is an engineer who inherently has a deep knowledge of our network
systems, hardware, and related management platforms. We apply software
engineering principles to common infrastructure systems with the goal of
making these systems as robust and as easy to use as possible for our
development teams across Kohl’s. Whether it’s building and managing complex
WANs, LANs, APIs, infrastructure-as-code, network services, or developer
tools, we build platforms that enable our development teams to move fast and
deliver business value. We crush our work as a team with product managers,
designers, and fellow engineers while grounding ourselves with data and
feedback. We relentlessly code, test, deploy, operate, and improve our
platforms until they achieve our desired outcomes and are a pleasure to use.

 **Responsible for:**

  * Engineering, enhancing, and supporting Kohl’s network infrastructure to enable our development teams to move their applications to production quickly and efficiently
  * Practicing and advocating for infrastructure engineering best practices like GitOps and overall infrastructure-as-code, driving quality, reliability, and security

 **Requires:**

  * CCNA-level Route/Switch knowledge with an emphasis on BGP and EIGRP
  * Strong understanding of network fundamentals and packet flow, including wireshark application analysis
  * Ability to reverse engineer complex infrastructure to assist other teams troubleshooting
  * High technical aptitude, self-starter, and continued drive to innovate and quickly adapt to change
  * Strong communication skills with an ability to effectively communicate highly technical concepts to leadership
  * 3+ years of relevant work experience
  * BA/BS in MIS, Information Technology, Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent experience

 **Preferred:**

  * Experience working with any of the following technologies:
  * Identity Services Engine (ISE)
  * Ironport WSA
  * F5 LTM/GTM
  * Firepower/ASA
  * DNS/DHCP/NTP
  * Cisco Wireless
  * SDWAN
  * Solarwinds Network Monitoring
  * Public Cloud (AWS/GCP/etc)
  * Private Cloud (ACI)
  * Experience automating with Python, Git, APIs, and other infrastructure automation tools

Job Title: Principal Network Engineer 3 in Hurlburt Field, FL
Job Description:
Requisition ID: R10038840

**Category:** Information Technology

**Location:** Hurlburt Field, Florida, United States of America

**Citizenship Required:** United States Citizenship

**Clearance Type:** Secret

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on
revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and
for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to
be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history
- from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to
landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a
pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the
way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and
bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what
others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history,
they're making history.

  
Defense Systems Sector is seeking a **Principal Systems Engineer** to join our
growing team in **Hurlburt Field, FL**

You will become part of Northrop Grumman’s Lifecycle Sustainment and
Modernization Solutions (LSMS). LSMS provides sustainment support for the US
Air Force B-2 Bomber, E-3 Sentry, Airborne Warning and Control System, HC-130
J Hercules and numerous other Government platforms. Our team members complete
engineering, reverse engineering, and logistics solution efforts to solve
complex obsolescence problems and ensure warfighter supportability.

This Network Engineer will support large projects within an Integrated Product
Team (IPT), to include Field Service Representative engineering reach back
support, technical planning, requirements development and tracking, system
integration, systems integrations lab (SIL), ground and flight testing,
verification and validation, airworthiness, system safety, risk, reliability /
maintainability, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for total
systems. Analyses are performed at all levels of total system product to
include: concept, requirements, design, fabrication, test, installation,
operation, maintenance and disposal.

 **Responsibilities:**

  * Ensure the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints

  * Perform or manage functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software specifications

  * Participate in the negotiation of contract and contract changes; coordinating the preparation of proposals, business plans, performance work statements and specifications

  * Serve as customer contact for program activities, as well as supporting program review sessions with customers to discuss cost, schedule, and technical performance

  * Establish design concepts, criteria and engineering efforts for product development, integration, and test

  * Establish milestones and monitors adherence to master plans and schedules

  * Identify program problems and obtains solutions, such as allocation of resources or changing contractual specifications

  * Act independently to uncover and resolve issues associated with the development and implementation of assigned projects

  * Participate in presenting company capabilities to potential customers and in the development of potential solutions to customer requirements

 **Basic Qualifications:**

  * Bachelor’s in Science or Engineering with a minimum of 5 years of System Engineering experience or a Master’s in Science or Engineering with a minimum of 3 years of System Engineering experience or a PhD in Science or Engineering with a minimum of 0 years of System Engineering experience

  * Experience in Systems Integration and Test

  * Must be able to work on-site at Hurlburt Field, FL

  * Strong customer engagement skills

  * Aircraft Modernization and Sustainment experience ****

  * Must be a US Citizen and have an active U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) Secret security clearance

 **Preferred Qualifications:**

  * Experience on HC-130J aircraft

  * Must be able to obtain certification as a DoD Information Assurance Level (II) technician. DoD IA Level II certification includes: A+, Network+, SSCP, Security+, CySA+, CCNA Security, GICSP, or GSEC

  * Experience with Situational Awareness Communication systems and managing SAMS-ESA software and associated laptop systems

  * Experience in large, embedded software systems

  * Advanced degree in a technical field

  * Experience with aircraft systems to include avionics, radar, communications, mission computing systems, global positioning systems, threat warning systems, navigation, structures, flight controls, offensive and/or defensive systems

  * Experience with obtaining flight and aircraft certifications

  * Experience developing the organization processes, procedures for various engineering analysis

  * OrCAD or similar design tool experience a plus

  * Experience with Air Force customers and aerospace industry and military standards

  * Active DoD Secret Security Clearance (or higher)

  * Experience with test planning at the circuit card, equipment and system level

  * Experience with information security, COMSEC and TEMPEST

  * Experience with embedded software development and/or cybersecurity

  * Experience conducting analysis of electrical components within aircraft maintenance programs, determining effectiveness and creating written recommendations for increasing efficiency and effectiveness

  * Experience interfacing with Weapons and Tactics, Planning, and Intelligence Sections in the development of mission requests, tasking, planning

NGLinkedDS

  

  

**Salary Range:** $79,700 USD - $119,500 USD

Our client located in the Pittsburgh, PA area is looking to hire a Cisco
Network Engineer with the following skills:

Job Purpose

The Cisco Network Engineer is responsible for the installation, maintenance,
and support of the data communications equipment and systems within our client
and affiliated business units for connectivity requests and/or reported
problems. The Cisco Network Engineer reviews, organizes, communicates, and
records all requests for data services. Additional responsibilities and
accountabilities include configuration of Cisco 9300 and 3850 switches, other
data communications devices, design and implementation of local and wide area
networking platforms, and problem determination knowledge in these areas. The
Cisco Network Engineer is expected to review, organize, communicate, and
record requests for service additions, deletions, and/or changes within our
client. The Cisco Network Engineer also will provide technical assistance to
departmental personnel, clients, vendors, and other parties as assigned to
meet business requirements or provide continued network services.

The Cisco Network Engineer works closely with all of our client's departments
and business units, ISD departments and/or groups, as required, to meet
business objectives, resolve problems, provide technical assistance in
accordance with assigned responsibilities, and when necessary, coordinates
with other telecommunications resources in carrying out the assigned
responsibilities. This position also interacts with vendors and suppliers.

Minimum Requirements  
Educational/Knowledge Requirements:

\- Acquisition of Core IT skills and knowledge via 3 years of Cisco
communications infrastructure (Switching) design and support experience.

\- Mastery of the essential basic knowledge base for an IT professional.

\- Demonstrate thorough understanding of the fundamental tools and concepts of
data network engineering and apply that understanding to make independent
practical contributions to Network data infrastructure installation, support,
and maintenance.

Preferred Certification:  
Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA Route/Switch)

Responsibilities  
\- Provide service to ISD client community, patients, families and visitors,
while protecting the integrity and confidentiality of all data and information
through physical and electronic measures.

\- Perform site surveys with ISD and client representatives to insure complete
and accurate record-keeping and project documentation for requested services,
including wiring requirements in support of the client request, specialized
power requirements in support of data and/or voice communications hardware.
Provide technical assistance pertaining to guidelines and/or rules/regulations
covering wiring systems and network infrastructure connectivity.

\- Maintain electronic documentation, as defined by the Manager outlining
wiring and interconnection for all of our client's facilities, as approved by
the Manager and/or the Director, ISD, including master and intermediate wiring
closet configurations, cross-connection to data communications hardware
(switches, routers, hubs, etc.), and other hardware as part of all projects
and/or initiatives assigned.

\- Coordinate with other ISD departments or assigned group/person, on all
requests for addition, relocation, and/or removal of required wiring to meet
network client requirement(s).

\- Review all assigned network client specialized service requests, received
through request notification systems and respond to client requests, within
service level, providing information as to service(s) and lead-time to meet
objective. Coordinate with client in service delivery activities and all
requirements to meet the request, keeping the client current on the status of
the service request (i.e. phone call, email, etc.).

\- Coordinate and support installation of data communications network hardware
including, but not limited to routers, switches, hubs, servers, terminals,
printers, personal computers, controllers, wireless access points, etc. as
outlined and documented in assigned project(s) and/or initiative(s).

\- Plan, publish, maintain, and distribute technical documentation pertaining
to the Data Communications network including pictures, procedures, practices,
and problem determination guidelines as requested or assigned by the Manager,
Data Communications, and/or the Director, ISD Technical Services Department.

\- Provide ISD Level II support services for problem calls escalated by the
NOC and coordinate with personnel and vendors to resolve issues. Report back
to the NOC on problem status until resolved.

\- Understand and explain network topologies, network hardware and protocols.

\- Troubleshoot network problems and knowledge of network troubleshooting
tools (Wireshark/NetScout).

\- Assist with network sizing and network troubleshooting.

\- Assist with installation and support of networks, including LAN/WAN/WLAN
systems.

\- Assist in the implementation and maintenance of data or voice and data
communication networks.

\- Familiarity with Cisco network management toolset (Prime Infrastructure,
APIC-EM, DNA Center is preferred)

\- Apprise project manager of status, schedule variances, and outstanding
issues.

\- Control project costs and communicate any project-related expenses to
project manager.

Job Title: Network IP / Linux System Test Engineer
Job Description:
**Senior IP NETWORK TEST ENGINEER**

 **90.00 per hour 1099**  
 **70.00 per hour W2 with Benefit Options, PTO and Holiday pay etc.**

 **EXPERIENCE:**

7+ years of industry experience in test engineering - testing of IP Network
backbone with Linux systems. We are looking for someone who can test the
systems on IP Networks with the Linux systems and do the IP Network and system
Testing; this is not an application tester job. **_Only candidates with strong
IP Network Testing and some Linux system testing need apply._**

 **TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:**

  * Experience with IP Networking protocols and standards
  * Experienced with Linux or other flavors of UNIX operating systems and systems and hardware
  * Experience developing and maintaining comprehensive system test plans for networks and systems- this is not an application tester; we need a system/network tester - in Linux/Unix environments with IP Networks
  * Must have experience with TCP/IP, UDP, sockets, etc. and experience in network performance testing
  * Experienced with IP router performance test tools such as Spirent, NetIQ Chariot, IXIA etc.
  * Scripting experience with Python is a plus
  * Experience in Telecom / Satcom industry is highly preferred

 **Overview:**

Vector continues to fuel its engineering growth and seeks an innovative,
creative Senior Test Engineer who is ready for the challenges,
responsibilities, and rewards that come with working in a high-energy, fast-
paced environment. VT iDirect provides next generation solutions for broadband
IP networking via satellite networks. As the leading innovators in this new
space, our diverse and talented team of Internet, satellite and
telecommunications professionals continues to break new ground and create
significant opportunities for network operators, for service providers and
resellers, and for corporate networking professionals.

Candidates must have a strong technical background and be capable of coming up
to speed on new technologies quickly. Good communication skills, great
problem-solving skills, and the ability to work both individually and
collaboratively in a team environment are required. If you enjoy working in a
fast-paced environment with the smartest team, and the very latest technology,
then this is the job for you!

 **RESPONSIBILITIES**

  * Design, develop, and document comprehensive test plans for all iDirect products.
  * Coordinate and participate in system level testing activities including test planning, execution, and reporting.
  * Perform setup of test scenarios, both hardware and software components, and perform troubleshooting as needed.
  * Validate product features end to end from customer point of view including scale scenarios to ensure a delivery ready product.
  * Troubleshoot the system and gather enough data to enable root cause analysis
  * Evaluate and recommend third-party test tools and other software/hardware products to aid in the system test effort.
  * Attend and participate in system-level design and other meetings to gather data and contribute to continuous improvement of test strategy
  * Create testing tools and scripts as needed to support system level testing activities.
  * Assist our technical writers in the creation of comprehensive product documentation
  * Mentor junior staff as needed
  * Other duties as assigned.

 **QUALIFICATIONS**

 **EDUCATION:**  
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Mathematics,
or equivalent experience  
Master’s Degree is a plus.

 **TECHNICAL EXPERIENCE**

  *  **NOTE; WE ARE NOT LOOKING FOR APPLICATION TESTERS; WE ARE LOOKING FOR A NETWORK IP TESTER WHO CAN TEST THE SYSTEMS AND THE NETWORK. WE ALREADY HAVE THE APPLCIATION TESTERS.**
  *  **Must have o** ver 7 years of industry experience in test engineering.
  * Must have experience with IP Networking protocols and standards and testing of IP Networks.
  * Experience with Linux or other flavors of UNIX
  * Experience developing and maintaining comprehensive system test plans
  * Knowledge of TCP/IP, UDP, sockets, etc. and experience in network performance testing
  * Experience with IP router performance test tools such as Spirent, NetIQ Chariot, IXIA etc.
  * Scripting experience with Python is a plus
  * Experience in Telecom / Satcom industry is highly preferred.
  * Strong verbal and written communications skills.

 **PROFESSIONAL QUALITIES:**

  * Has a ‘can do’ attitude - willing to dive into and take ownership of critical design issues.
  * Demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment.
  * Must be able to analyze and solve technical problems.
  * Must be able to look under the hood to appreciate the low-level functionality of the tools.
  * Must have strong interpersonal skills and be self-motivated.
  * Completes tasks in a timely manner.
  * Communicates effectively on a technical level.
  * Can work under pressure in high visibility situations.
  * Flexible - able to quickly adapt to changing conditions and make decisions based on incomplete data.
  * While we emphasis the ability to work in a team, the candidate must also be effective as a single contributor as the situation warrants.
  * Willing to take direction and follow sound software development processes.

  * 8 hour shift

**Employment Type : W2 Hourly**

 **Duration: 6+ Months Contract**

 **Description :**

The Network Operations Engineer ensures the stability and integrity of
enterprise voice, data, video, and wireless network services. This is achieved
by planning, designing, and developing local- and wide area networks across
the organizational and cloud services. In addition, the Network Engineer
participates in installing, monitoring, maintaining, supporting, and
optimizing all network hardware, software, and communication links. The
incumbent also analyzes and resolves network hardware and software problems in
a timely and accurate fashion and provides end-user training.

To be, the incumbent must have a strong understanding of network
infrastructure and network hardware and be able to implement, administer, and
troubleshoot network devices, including WAPs, firewalls, routers, switches,
and controllers. A deep knowledge of application transport and network
infrastructure protocols is also needed.

 **ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

  * Develop and maintain asset planning and management strategy for network design and operation.
  * Develop and implement network guidelines and performance standards for QoS, Security, and Network Monitoring.
  * Maintain and administer AWS Cloud Core, Distribution, and Customer Edge Devices which includes but is not limited to Cisco, Ruckus, Brocade, and planet layer 2 and layer 3 network devices.
  * Analyze complex technical problems across all technology layers for quick resolution using packet capture and other diagnostics tools.
  * Work with third-party carriers, vendors, and suppliers to resolve network issues and plan for growth.
  * Analyze current network performance and plan for future needs.
  * Support and administer firewall environments in line with security policy; identify and mitigate potential network vulnerability risks.
  * Work with Engineering department support teams to update policies and procedures relating to the upkeep and performance of all parts of the network, including hardware and software.
  * Work and collaborate with IT groups and business units in support of projects, application performance, and security compliance to build and deliver solutions.
  * Participate in on-call support for issues outside of regular business hours.
  * Facilitate internal meetings with managers and other team members, or meetings with vendors completing project activities, to review project status and implement changes as necessary.
  * Collect, draft, and deliver to management Event Analyses and/or Root Cause Analysis (?RCA?) and RCA summations.
  * Document network processes, procedures, working instructions, work-flows, network topology data, and as-built data.

 **QUALIFICATIONS:**

  * Familiarity with Amazon Web Services: EC2, S3, CloudFormation, RDS, CloudFront, VPC, Route53, IAM, CloudWatch, Beanstalk, and Lambda.
  * Detailed understanding of core network protocols and services (TCP/IP, HTTP/HTTPS, REST/SOAP, FTPS/SFTP, DNS, SSL, firewalls, load balancers).
  * Experience scripting against APIs.
  * Strong ability to communicate to technical and non-technical recipients via email and written and verbal reports.
  * Strong change management skills and ability to influence decision makers.
  * Ability to direct the diagnosis of technical problems and critical paths and institute remedies.
  * Strong analytical, problem-solving and conceptual skills.
  * Ability to work with different functional groups levels of employees throughout the organization to effectively and professionally achieve results.
  * Strong follow-up skills; ability to organize timelines and follow up with internal and external customer needs.
  * Strong customer service skills.
  * Strong written, oral, and presentation skills, including the ability to present ideas and suggestions clearly and effectively.
  * Strong organizational skills; ability to accomplish multiple tasks within agreed upon timeframes through effective prioritization of duties and functions in a fast paced environment.
  * Strong track record of building and maintaining solid relationships with internal and external customers and vendors.
  * Self-motivated; able to work both independently to complete tasks and respond to department requests and with others to utilize their resources and knowledge to identify high quality solutions.

 **EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:**

  * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline, or equivalent work experience required.
  * At least 5 years of Network Engineering experience and at least 2 years of Tier 2/3 Technical Support experience required.
  * At least 2 years of experience with Linux system administration, including virtualization, along with wireless security and RADIUS AAA skills preferred.
  * Solid understanding of network security principles and concepts (including VPN) preferred.
  * CCNA, CCNP, CCNP Cloud, Wireless, etc., technical certifications preferred.

 **ENVIRONMENT:**

Approximately 95% performed in climate-controlled internal office environment
working under normal office conditions. Approximately 5% travel may be
required in support of the position’s responsibilities.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to
sit, stand, walk, use hands and fingers to feel and handle, reach with arms
and hands, talk and hear. While performing the duties of this job, the
employee frequently is required to stoop, kneel and crouch, lift weight or
exert a force up to a maximum of 25 pounds.

 **ADDITIONAL:**

We are a dynamic organization in a rapidly changing industry. Accordingly, the
responsibilities associated with this job will change from time to time in
accordance with business needs. More specifically, the incumbent may be
required to perform additional and/or different responsibilities from those
set forth above.

The above declarations are intended to be neither an all-inclusive list of the
job’s duties and responsibilities nor such a listing of the skills and
abilities required to do the job. Rather, they are intended only to describe
the job’s general nature.

The incumbent must be flexible as there may be workweeks that require more
than 40 hours to ensure the position’s expectations and responsibilities are
met.

Responsibilities  
As a Network Engineer on a Network Operations Center (NOC) team your role will
be to maintain the tools that allow you to monitor the network, to solve any
issues that your monitoring presents, and to provide a point of escalation to
the Network Services team. You will document every incident, so you are able
to provide insights and recommendations to the teams doing network deployment,
design, and architecture so that network stability and reliability improves
over time. The team will review incident, vulnerability, and maintenance
information from vendors and document and convey this information to the rest
of the team. Your passion for engineering should be visible to your team,
stakeholders and in everything you do.  
  
You are  

    * A strong problem solver. You take deep pride in your work and view each new problem as an opportunity for success; you approach challenges creatively, but methodically

DESCRIPTION:

Our client is a leading information technology provider of infrastructure and
enterprise application solutions. The client combines the technical expertise
of consultants with the technologies from strategic business partners to solve
information technology issues impacting clients' businesses.

Our client is seeking a candidate who is passionate about technology, learning
and developing new skills, and providing the best customer experience as
possible. If you have the skillsets and experience supporting data center
infrastructure and different technologies, this is a great opportunity for you

The resource for this position will have 5+ years' experience as a Network
Engineer and comfortable in supporting highly available 24x7 production
environments. In addition to network experience, familiarity with Cloud
platforms, monitoring toolsets and customer interaction is needed. As a member
of this practice, you will communicate and consult with our client's business
and technical personnel, blending with their IT team and working together to
help identify potential problems and develop solutions.  
As much as this is a highly technical position, communication skills are of
equal importance and the candidate will be required to act as a Service
Delivery Manager for certain clients and must be able to work with a global
team. Candidate must have strong experience interacting via email, phone calls
and video conferences with clients and IT Managers. They must also possess the
ability to craft documentation for the US marketplace, present technical
topics to upper IT management in an engaging and effective manner, and work
with global overseas resources.

RESPONSIBILITIES  
The successful person for this role is an experienced Network Engineer who has
a good mix of experience in different technologies as well (Virtualization,
Cloud, and/or OS.) They should have experience in some combination of the
following specific skillsets:

REQUIREMENTS

  * Advanced Network experience with top OEM platforms (Cisco, HPE, Aruba, Fortinet)
  * Experience architecting, designing, and supporting wired and wireless networks
  * Familiarity with VMware NSX and NSX-T
  * Experience with supporting environments that reside in a public, private, and hybrid cloud deployment. Experience with Azure and/or AWS is preferred.
  * Experience (5+ years) with production administration experience in a high-availability, multi-site, 24x7 environment
  * Experience (5+ years) in managing and administering network based firewalls
  * Familiarity with infrastructure monitoring platforms

POSITIVES:

  * Automation and DevOps experience is a plus
  * Experience with using ServiceNow and ITL Framework
  * Previous MSP experience
  * Desire to take on different challenges and learn new technologies

DAY TO DAY REQUIREMENTS

  * Work with team members and clients by responding to ticket requests to complete services identified in Service Orders
  * Troubleshoot, diagnose, and remediate issues
  * Provide guidance and recommendations to clients to ensure best practices are followed for: architecture, performance, capacity, and monitoring
  * Assist with deployment of monitoring and management toolsets
  * Work with a variety of clients and supporting different technologies and solutions
  * Act as Service Delivery Manager for a set of clients
  * Serve as Subject Matter Expert in assisting sale teams to close deals
  * Work with Managed Service team members to continue to fine tune solution offering
  * Act as a presales resource when needed
  * Work with vendors and OEM for escalations
  * Excellent communication skills are a must! Due to the amount of client interaction required daily, candidates must have the ability to effectively and efficiently communicate in emails, craft multi-page documentation, and speak fluent English on the phone.
  * Ability to work independently with strong time-management skills and personal accountability to complete tasks in a timely manner
  * Ability to work within a rotating, on-call weekly schedule
  * Based on client needs, after-hours and weekend work may occasionally be required

 **Essential Job Details:**

  * Plans, designs, recommends, installs, upgrades, and supports data center activities and systems of data,voice, radio and video network infrastructures, equipment, servers, and applications to achieve optimum performance in accordance with the IT Service Level Agreement (SLA).
  * Reviews and evaluates technological network-related needs and recommends appropriate solutions; works closely with vendors to ensure complete and successful projects.

  * Monitors system capacity and utilization and performance of systems or networks and performs necessary restructure or recommends expansion.
  * Upgrades network operating systems, server and storage systems, and configures software.
  * Researches, designs, develops security and integrity of network systems to ensure protection from inappropriate access or destruction to include disaster recovery and business continuity.
  * Implements a preventive maintenance routine identifying weaknesses of current system to determine critical server/storage or networking issues.
  * Evaluates and monitors cost acquisition of network and server-related items to obtain the best results, meet budget guidelines and ensure system compatibility.
  * Assists in the development and execution of preventive maintenance programs identifying weaknesses of current systems to determine critical server/storage or network issues, including cybersecurity.
  * Develops technical system documentation, training materials and provides training to users and other support staff.
  * Leads and coordinates IT, departmental, and vendor resources for projects in accordance with project plan.
  * Prepares presentation materials for meetings, documents and follows up accordingly.
  * Assists in the development and operations of the IT Strategic Plan (ITSP).

  * Communicates clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing.
  * Assists in the creation of operational procedure manuals.
  * Sets timelines and expectations for tasks within a or various project plans.
  * Provides guidance to team members.
  * Acts as a liaison between the various divisions within the department along with the client departments.

  * Principles and practices of ITSM (IT Service Management) systems to include incident/problem management; request fulfilment; knowledgebase; asset management and IT service catalogs.

  * Methods and procedures of systems administration and security and integrity maintenance.
  * Connectivity, system integration, and network design.
  * Structure development, features, and access including configurations protocol and interfacing.
  * Current developments and trends of network technologies and/or server/data storage technologies.
  * Principles and methods of system and storage capacity, physical, virtual and cloud-based Local Area Network wiring and distribution methods.
  * Wide Areas Networking Connectivity utilizing T1, T3 and fiber backbone transports.
  * Advanced cybersecurity practices and procedures.
  * Applicable industry and safety codes and technology standards.
  * Microsoft Office, Microsoft Project and Microsoft Visio.

  * Proven customer service skills
  * Effective interpretation and explanatory skill regarding processes, regulations, and IT protocols

**Network Engineer**

  * Long Beach, CA
  * Full-time

 **About SCAN**

As one of the nation’s largest not-for-profit Medicare Advantage plans,
serving more than 270,000 members in California, Arizona, and Nevada, SCAN
Health Plan has been a mission-driven organization dedicated to keeping
seniors healthy and independent for over 40 years. SCAN employees are
passionate about what they do, and understand that success is based on
achieving the mission. Employees are afforded with the training and tools
necessary to do their jobs and are rewarded for their efforts and recognized
as experts in their fields. To learn more, visit scanhealthplan.com or follow
us on social media: LinkedIn; Facebook; and Twitter.

 **The Opportunity**

Oversees the installation, configuration, and maintenance of networked
information systems.

 **You Will**

  * Provides analytical, technical, and administrative support in the planning, design, and installation of new and existing Cisco systems and services.
  * Maintains network operations by providing oversight, direction, and control of network equipment.
  * Follows designated policies and procedures.
  * Monitors equipment performance and manages regular maintenance and testing to ensure network integrity.
  * Forecasts long-term networking equipment requirements to support strategic initiatives
  * Conducts technical studies and analysis.
  * Develops and implements status reports regarding system activities.
  * Manages contracted vendors by scheduling services; monitoring vendor service and quality levels; conducting quarterly audits of service functions; handling corrective actions; assisting in hiring contractors, negotiating contracts, and setting goals.
  * Manages projects by developing project plans; working in teams; meeting deadlines; keeping parties informed; responding to issues.
  * Maintains client confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential.
  * Provides escalation support for Helpdesk and Desktop Support teams as well as other groups within IT. Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

 **Requirements**

 **Your Qualifications**

  * Bachelor's Degree, or equivalent combination of college and work experience required.
  * Training and certification in one or more leading network operating systems, preferably Cisco IOS.
  * Training and certification on network equipment and protocols.
  * CISCO Certified Network Associate (CCNA) and/or CISCO Certified Networking Professional (CCNP) certifications preferred.
  * 5+ years of experience in a corporate headquarters in Cisco networking is required.
  * 5+ years of experience with Cisco networking products including but not limited to Cisco routers and switches.
  * Experience with Cisco Wi-Fi, Cisco ACI, Cisco ISE and Cisco Prime.
  * Experience in F5 Load Balancers (LTM, GTM, and APM Modules)
  * 3 + years of experience in network security technologies.
  * 3 + years of Palo Alto Networks firewall experience is required
  * 3+ years of experience with Cisco UCS technology is preferable.
  * Ability to network and integrate disparate systems and services into a cohesive system for the organization as a whole.
  * Ability to perform and/or coordinate network related software and hardware changes, including cable terminations and troubleshooting. Strong communication skills, both with internal and external clients
  * Working knowledge of IBM/PC compatible and software applications to the extent necessary to develop and maintain computerized records required. Windows XP, MS Office and MS Access preferred.
  * Working knowledge of IP Telephony/VOIP preferred.
  * Experience in Telecom technologies a plus.
  * Co-Lo/DR architecture and design would be a plus.
  * Working experiences with Microsoft Windows Server products, Active Directory, DNS, DHCP a plus.
  * Networking: Switches, Routers, Hubs, Servers, Cables, Racks, Firewalls, LAN, WAN, TCP/IP, DNS, UDP, Latency, VoIP, QoS, EIGRP, BGP, OSPF, NHRP, ATM, PPP, MPLS
  * Hands-on experience with Cisco Nexus product line switches is a must.
  * Knowledge of Cisco IWAN and/or SD-WAN technology is preferable.
  * Working knowledge of Wireless technology security and communications protocols. CWNA certification preferable but not required.

 **CONDITIONS OF WORK:**

  * Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8am to 5pm. Extended work hours, as needed.
  * May require weekend work for projects or major changes.
  * May require non-traditional work hours when networking systems need attention.
  * May require being part of the on-call rotation schedule.
  * Spends approximately 90% of time in facility.
  * Drives approximately 10% of time to other company locations.

Job Title: Network IP / Linux System Test Engineer
Job Description:
**Senior IP NETWORK TEST ENGINEER**

 **90.00 per hour 1099**  
 **70.00 per hour W2 with Benefit Options, PTO and Holiday pay etc.**

 **EXPERIENCE:**

7+ years of industry experience in test engineering - testing of IP Network
backbone with Linux systems. We are looking for someone who can test the
systems on IP Networks with the Linux systems and do the IP Network and system
Testing; this is not an application tester job. **_Only candidates with strong
IP Network Testing and some Linux system testing need apply._**

 **TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:**

  * Experience with IP Networking protocols and standards
  * Experienced with Linux or other flavors of UNIX operating systems and systems and hardware
  * Experience developing and maintaining comprehensive system test plans for networks and systems- this is not an application tester; we need a system/network tester - in Linux/Unix environments with IP Networks
  * Must have experience with TCP/IP, UDP, sockets, etc. and experience in network performance testing
  * Experienced with IP router performance test tools such as Spirent, NetIQ Chariot, IXIA etc.
  * Scripting experience with Python is a plus
  * Experience in Telecom / Satcom industry is highly preferred

 **Overview:**

Vector continues to fuel its engineering growth and seeks an innovative,
creative Senior Test Engineer who is ready for the challenges,
responsibilities, and rewards that come with working in a high-energy, fast-
paced environment. VT iDirect provides next generation solutions for broadband
IP networking via satellite networks. As the leading innovators in this new
space, our diverse and talented team of Internet, satellite and
telecommunications professionals continues to break new ground and create
significant opportunities for network operators, for service providers and
resellers, and for corporate networking professionals.

Candidates must have a strong technical background and be capable of coming up
to speed on new technologies quickly. Good communication skills, great
problem-solving skills, and the ability to work both individually and
collaboratively in a team environment are required. If you enjoy working in a
fast-paced environment with the smartest team, and the very latest technology,
then this is the job for you!

 **RESPONSIBILITIES**

  * Design, develop, and document comprehensive test plans for all iDirect products.
  * Coordinate and participate in system level testing activities including test planning, execution, and reporting.
  * Perform setup of test scenarios, both hardware and software components, and perform troubleshooting as needed.
  * Validate product features end to end from customer point of view including scale scenarios to ensure a delivery ready product.
  * Troubleshoot the system and gather enough data to enable root cause analysis
  * Evaluate and recommend third-party test tools and other software/hardware products to aid in the system test effort.
  * Attend and participate in system-level design and other meetings to gather data and contribute to continuous improvement of test strategy
  * Create testing tools and scripts as needed to support system level testing activities.
  * Assist our technical writers in the creation of comprehensive product documentation
  * Mentor junior staff as needed

**Description/Job Summary**

Description

The Network Engineer's role is to ensure the stability and integrity of in-
house voice, data, video, and wireless network services. This is achieved by
planning, designing, and developing local area networks (LANs) and wide area
networks (WANs) across the organization. In addition, the Sr. Network Engineer
will participate with the installation, monitoring, maintenance, support, and
optimization of all network hardware, software, and communication links. This
individual will also analyze and resolve network hardware and software
problems in a timely and accurate fashion and provide end user training where
required.

 **Responsibilities/Duties**

Strategy & Planning

  * Collaborate with executive management and department leaders to assess near- and long-term network capacity needs.

  * Create and maintain documentation as it relates to network configuration, network mapping, processes, and service records.

  * Develop, implement and maintain policies, procedures, and associated training plans for network administration, usage, and disaster recovery.

  
Acquisition & Deployment

  * Design and deploy company LANs, WANs, and wireless networks, including servers, routers, hubs, switches, UPSs, and other hardware.

  * Conduct research on network products, services, protocols, and standards to remain abreast of developments in the networking industry.

  * Oversee new and existing equipment, hardware, and software upgrades.

  
Operational Management

  * Configure networks to ensure their smooth and reliable operation for fulfilling business objectives and processes.

  * Monitor network performance and troubleshoot problem areas as needed.

  * Oversee installation, configuration, maintenance, and troubleshooting of end user workstation hardware, software, and peripheral devices.

  * Ensure network connectivity of all servers, workstations, telephony equipment, fax machines, and other network appliances.

  * Practice network asset management, including maintenance of network component inventory and related documentation and technical specifications information.

  * Monitor and test network performance and provide network performance statistics and reports.

  * Participate in managing all network security solutions.

 **Required Experience**

Technical Knowledge

  * Detailed knowledge managing and deploying Cisco, Aruba, and Palo Alto devices.

  * Detailed knowledge of network monitoring protocols and tools. (SNMP, Netflow, Solarwinds)

  * SDWAN experience preferred.

  * Cisco Meraki experience preferred.

  * Working experience with advance routing protocols. (EIGRP, OSPF, BGP)

  * 7-10 years supporting an enterprise level network.

  * Detailed knowledge of Layer 3 switching and VLANs.

  * Desire indepth knowledge of Forescout NAC solution.

The Network Engineer will provide direction, information, and recommendations
regarding network configurations and installations following ICG’s best
practices. Responsibilities include:

  * Establishes networking environment by designing system configuration; directing system installation; defining, documenting, and enforcing system standards.
  * Maximizes network performance by monitoring performance; troubleshooting network problems and outages; scheduling upgrades; collaborating with network architects on network optimization.
  * Secures network system by establishing and enforcing policies; defining and monitoring access.
  * Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
  * Accomplishes information systems and organization mission by completing related results as needed.
  * Reports network operational status by gathering, prioritizing information; managing projects.
  * Maintains multi-site network operations and software applications, operating systems and regular maintenance in all facilities.
  * Manages assigned projects and program components to deliver services in accordance with established objectives.
  * Responds to inquiries from staff, administrators, service providers, site personnel and outside vendors to provide technical assistance and support.
  * Troubleshoots malfunctions of network hardware and software applications to resolve operational issues and restore services.
  * Performs other duties as assigned.

  * Experience in troubleshooting and performing Root Cause Analysis on Networking issues on both the Physical and Virtual topology layers.

  * Experience architecting, designing, implementing, monitoring, and operating complex Virtual Networks using VMware NSX-V and NSX-T or similar technologies.

  * Experience designing and implementing complex spine-and-leaf Networks using physical Cisco/Juniper ToR Switches.

  * Understands complex Physical and Virtual Network Toplogies and is able to design new complex networks.

  * Experience configuring BGP Peering on Top Of Rack Switches.

  * Experience working in a modern Jumbo Frames environment with large frame and packet sizes.

  * Experience creating VLANs on physical ToR Cisco and Juniper switches.

  * Experience designing and deploying Load Balancers and Virtual Servers.

  * Experience creating new Subnets on physical Cisco and Juniper switches

Qualifications

  * 5+ years’ experience working as a Network Engineer and Architect. Network Integrator experience preferred.
  * Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or similar
  * Certifications: Internet Security (certification not required with security experience), ITIL or ISO27001/2
  * Exchange 2010/2013, Working knowledge of MS SQL(CCNA, CCNP, CCIE, CNE)
  * Systems: Windows, Cisco Systems, UNIX, Linux, Novell, Dell VX Rail

  * Problem Solving: LAN Knowledge, Microsoft Network Troubleshooting, Network Hardware Configuration, Network Performance Tuning, Proficient knowledge of IP, Basic Knowledge of Cisco switches and routers, Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Office desktop support

**Job Description:**

HarborTech Mobility is actively seeking a Network and Security Engineer to
join our fast-growing team! The network and security professional services
team designs and builds WLAN and LAN solutions that scale to support large
customers across the country. We are looking for technologists with broad
expertise who can provide a high standard of collaboration, mentorship and
solutions to complex problems.

 **Duties and Responsibilities:**

\- - Provide Professional Services to HarborTech Mobility’s clients to design,
architect, plan, implement and test of enterprise network and security
solutions.

\- Hands on design and configuration of LANs and firewalls incorporating best
practices and industry standard tools to tune and optimize systems for
immediate customer use.

\- Provide Professional Services Projects to design and deploy AAA & NAC
systems for secure access.

\- Guarantee network security best practices are executed through auditing.

\- Provide Tier 3 support and work occasionally with the NOC team to
troubleshoot and resolve complex LAN and security technical incidents.

\- Assist the sales team during the Pre-Sales process by serving as a
technical consultant.

\- Produce engineering documents (network diagrams, testing procedures, audit
reports, etc.)

\- Utilize excellent listening skills and strong written and spoken
communications skills to enhance efficient project deliveries.

\- Work outside normal business hours when required - scheduled maintenance,
outage response, last minute urgent requests

 **Requirements:**

\- Strong, current hands-on experience (3-5 years) in the following areas:

o Analysis, architecture, design and support of Juniper Networks, Palo Alto
Networks, Fortinet, Cisco Systems, or equivalent combination of those
technologies

o Excellent hands-on experience and knowledge implementing, configuring,
integrating and supporting the network security with Palo Alto, Cisco ASA
and/or Fortinet. (Not all are needed but the more you have, the more
advantages you accrue in securing a job)

o Good knowledge of networking concepts, routing and switching technologies,
WAN connectivity and transport types and protocols

o Developing and implementing wired and wireless Access & Control Systems
(Aruba ClearPass, Cisco ISE, Microsoft NPS)

o Switching technologies and protocols (VLANs, STP, LACP, Stacking, VRRP/HSRP,
static routing, etc.)

\- Knowledge of IPSec and SSL VPNs

\- Experience with protocol analysis tools and network management systems

\- Ability to create detailed documentation and diagrams to reflect processes,
traffic flows and network architectures

\- Must be able to quickly learn and apply new technologies

\- Excellent organizational skills and multi-tasking ability

\- Must be able to travel to customer sites if required (25% of time on
average)

\- Excellent oral and written communication skills

\- Ability to succeed in a dynamic and fast-paced environment

\- Customer focused and results oriented

 **Desirable skills and experience:**

\- Network certifications: Juniper JNCIA or JNCIP-ENT, Palo Alto PCNSA or
PCNSE, Fortinet NSE4 or higher, Cisco CCNP, etc. are highly desired

\- Experience working with Microsoft Active Directory and VMWare

\- Consulting Experience

 **Benefits:**

\- Work in a rapidly growing company with exposure to large organizations
across US

\- Paid holidays

\- Work remotely

\- Cell phone and internet reimbursement

\- Medical care coverage

\- PTO/Sick Leave

MI Technical Solutions seeks qualified candidates to fill immediate openings
for experienced Network Engineer positions in San Diego and other US Navy
bases.

Who we are: MI Technical Solutions is a Women-Owned Small Business (WOSB)
comprised of a broad range of talented employees that provide diversified
engineering and technical support services since 2004! Our team works
tirelessly to build a respected, results-oriented brand. We are headquartered
in Chesapeake, VA with employees located near each of the Navy Fleet Centers
within the continental United States (San Diego, Jacksonville, Seattle, New
England, Norfolk) as well as Hawaii and Japan.

What you will do: As a Network Engineer on our team, you will work with U. S.
Navy personnel to assist in migrating data to temporary networks built by you.
Our team supports continuity of day-to-day operations while US Navy ships are
undergoing extended periods of maintenance and upgrades. You will communicate
with customers and develop timeline of milestones for each project. During the
project, you will work with technicians and stakeholders to ensure a smooth
transition to a temporary LAN utilized by the customer. While the ship is
operating on the temporary network, you will act as their point of contact for
any network concerns. You will also check in with the customer periodically in
order to maintain a high level of communication, perform health checks on the
system, ensure proper operation, and verify successful data backups.

Additionally, MITS Teams are involved in research and development projects to
include artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML). We primarily
support the US military and routinely partner with institutions of higher
learning. You may be invited to support these endeavors and bring your talents
to strengthen ongoing projects.

What you bring to the Team: Five years Network Engineering and/or System
Administrator with experience in servers, storage devices, writing and editing
configurations of switching and routing equipment. Advanced knowledge of Cisco
products is ideal.

What you get in return: Benefits include highly competitive pay; Comprehensive
Medical, Dental and Vision insurance; Life and A&D coverage; Disability
coverage; Employee Assistance Programs; 401 (k) Plan with company
contributions; Paid Time Off and all federal holidays paid; Educational
Assistance; Legal Insurance

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on
revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and
for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to
be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history
- from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to
landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a
pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the
way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and
bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what
others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history,
they're making history.

  
Northrop Grumman's Enterprise Services (ES) organization is seeking an IT
Network Engineer at its Redondo Beach, CA location. This is a full time
Network Engineer position reporting to the Regional Network Operations
Manager, within the ECSN (Enterprise Compute, Storage, and Network) of ES Next
Gen organization. The successful candidate will provide network engineering
and design duties for the NGUSN site networks.

Roles and Responsibilities include:

  * Design, plan and deploy network communications systems.
  * Provides specifications and detailed schematics for NG site network architecture.
  * Provide specific detailed information for network hardware and software selection, including present and future capacity requirements.
  * Provide documentation as required to ensure accurate and current information is available for each site network.
  * Conduct testing of network design.
  * Maintain technical expertise in all areas of network and computer hardware and software interconnection and interfacing, such as routers, firewalls, deep packet inspection analysis, application packet analysis, switches (Nexus and Catalyst), and proxies (Reverse and Forward),etc.
  * Provide guidance to junior engineers and other personnel to maintain and ensure domestic and international data centers are compliant with published directives and procedures.
  * Evaluate and report on new communications technologies to enhance capabilities of the network.
  * Flexible hours are required, with a willingness to work weekends/off hours as needed for planned work or unplanned break/fix support.
  * Lift 40 lbs.
  * Some travel will be required.

Basic Qualifications:

  * Associate’s degree and 11 years of experience; 9 Years of experience with Bachelors in Science; 7 Years with Masters. In lieu of formal education, 13 Years of applied experience will be considered. 
  * Experience with Cisco routers, switches, load-balancers, and firewalls.
  * Experience performing network forensics.
  * Ability to obtain and maintain an active DOD Top Secret clearance.

Preferred Qualifications:

  * Cisco certification
  * Active Top Secret Clearance
  * Experience with F-5, Palo Alto Networks, VMware is a plus.
  * Experience with BGP, OSPF and DNS.
  * Experience with MS PowerPoint and Visio to transform complex technical information into high-level, concise and clear presentations.
  * Experience in project management.
