Imagine what you could do here! At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming
extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences. When you bring
passion and dedication to your job, there is no telling what you can
accomplish! Come join the networking team that supports Apple’s Global
Backbone and Internet peering infrastructure! We're a team of seasoned
professionals that maintain and operate one of the world’s largest service
provider based backbone to connect all of Apple’s businesses globally. We are
growing and building the fastest and most reliable network backbone to meet
Apple’s phenomenal scale and unique requirements. The Senior Network Engineer
will be working in a and fast-paced environment while developing,
implementing, and supporting a complex backbone. To be successful in this
role, the candidate being sought after is required to possess extensive
experience in engineering and operations of very large-scale
enterprise/service provider networks.

## **Key Qualifications**

  * At least 5 years of network operations and/or network design background
  * In-depth experience in TCP/IP (v4 and v6), BGP and MPLS technologies.
  * Proficiency in underlying LAN/WAN technologies and protocols.
  * Experience supporting large-scale peering/transit networks, with a sound knowledge of complex traffic engineering and Internet routing policies.
  * Extensive hands-on experience with carrier-grade routers and operating systems.
  * Proficiency in MacOS, Linux, or other variations of UNIX.
  * Working knowledge of DWDM Optical Transport technologies.
  * Strong analytical and interpersonal skills, including proven abilities to adapt to dynamic project environments, while able to manage multiple
  * Strong troubleshooting methodology and experience in an operational environment.
  * Strong software development skills, including Python programming and Ansible/Shell scripting is highly regarded.

## **Description**

As a Senior Network Engineer with the Global Network Services (GNS) team you
will work in a dynamic team environment and be responsible for the day-to-day
upkeep of the global Backbone and Internet peering infrastructure. The
candidate is also expected to carry out regular network maintenances to
migrate, upgrade and augment the infrastructure that supports both, internal
and external customers. The candidate is also expected to occasionally
participate in network designs, defining and development of toolings and
automations to enable large-scale deployment and operations. The ideal
candidate will collaborate with vendors on bug fixes and new features, while
liaising with peers in Operations/Engineering and Architecture to ensure
alignment of technical requirements. The successful candidate will need to
excel in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, with the ability to multi-task
and provide not only operational support for the Backbone, but must also work
closely with multi-functional teams to resolve critical network incidents.
This engineer will need to obsess over the customer experience and drive
operational excellence in their everyday work habits through strong technical
leadership and mentorship.

## **Education & Experience**

BS or equivalent industry experience.

## **Additional Requirements**

  * Participate in global on-call rotations.

## **Summary**

Posted: Feb 10, 2022

Weekly Hours: **40**

Role Number: **200336116**

With Apple being the most valuable company globally, mention you could learn a
lot about cutting-edge technology. New innovative ideas have a way of becoming
unique products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Every single
day, people do amazing things at Apple. Do you want to impact billions of
users by developing a unique product with a prime focus on accuracy,
understandability, and performance? Bring passion and dedication to your job,
and there's no telling what you could accomplish! As part of the Enterprise
Network Reliability Team, you will be responsible for the operations,
installation, configuration, integration, and automation of the network
infrastructure across Apple's Enterprise and development network centers
across the AMR region. You will support all corporate Data, wireless,
security, voice, and video application services, including connectivity for
all businesses across Apple. You will demonstrate leadership, collaboration,
and interpersonal skills while working with our various business units. This
role assists the IS&T organization and their peers in delivering excellence,
standardizing, automating, and maintaining our network infrastructure.

## **Key Qualifications**

  * 6 to 8 years of experience in Routing, Switching, Firewall security & Automation
  * Strong knowledge and troubleshooting skills needed in BGP, SDN, OSPF, IPv4/IPv6, MP-BGP, EVPN, VXLAN, SWITCHING, MAB, DOT1X
  * Strong knowledge in analyzing and troubleshooting - Access Control Lists, Multicast. QoS, Wired Technologies, and low latency environment
  * Strong Knowledge in PAN Firewalls - Installing, maintaining security policies and hardware and software upgrades.
  * Strong Automation skills - Python and Ansible.
  * Understanding of Virtualization, NFV, and SDN.
  * Strong analytical and organizational skills along with a professional demeanor.
  * Proven ability to adapt in a dynamic environment and run multiple projects
  * Responding to emergencies and performing effective troubleshooting during production outages.
  * Ability to handle multi vendor products and environment.

## **Description**

Our team owns the AMR Enterprise campus, FSOs, and development infrastructure
across Apple for corporate connectivity services, data, wireless, and firewall
security. We work to understand how all critical applications and services
require consistent connectivity along with SLA/SLO's. We need to have
adaptability for new technology and create strategies to benefit Apple's
growing infrastructure. On our team you will work with many cross functional
internal teams to lead and deliver premier products in an exciting, dynamic
environment! Some day to day responsibilities include: • Ensure operational
perfection across our infrastructure • Work towards standard templates and
automation tasks, ensure project documentation is complete, shared, and
updated periodically • Work closely with Apple's Business units to understand
our application needs for transport end to end • Partner with architecture &
engineering in developing networking standards to meet these business needs
with future development of next-gen systems.

## **Education & Experience**

BS degree or equivalent industry experience

## **Additional Requirements**

    * CCIE or equivalent certifications
    * Firewall certification or equivalent experience
    * Participate in on-call (7 x 24) support rotation with other team members.

The Network Engineer Lead is responsible for researching, designing,
documenting, building, testing, deploying, analyzing, administering, and
maintaining the enterprise network environment, including hardware and
software components, to meet current and future business needs. This includes
monitoring and controlling the performance and status of enterprise network
environment technology components and providing network technology component
support and problem resolution. You will need advanced knowledge with
utilizing proven systems, scripting, and developer skills to execute on highly
complex tasks related to hardware and software technology component analysis,
integration, and incident and problem resolution. The role also creates,
reviews, and ensures updates are made to the configuration management plan.  

  * Assists with the following activities (concerning new or existing network hardware and software technology components or enhancements to existing components): research, analysis, selection, planning, document, implement, and train.

 **About SCAN**

As one of the nation’s largest not-for-profit Medicare Advantage plans,
serving more than 270,000 members in California, Arizona, and Nevada, SCAN
Health Plan has been a mission-driven organization dedicated to keeping
seniors healthy and independent for over 40 years. SCAN employees are
passionate about what they do, and understand that success is based on
achieving the mission. Employees are afforded with the training and tools
necessary to do their jobs and are rewarded for their efforts and recognized
as experts in their fields. To learn more, visit scanhealthplan.com or follow
us on social media: LinkedIn; Facebook; and Twitter.

 **The Opportunity**

Oversees the installation, configuration, and maintenance of networked
information systems.

 **You Will**

  * Provides analytical, technical, and administrative support in the planning, design, and installation of new and existing Cisco systems and services.
  * Maintains network operations by providing oversight, direction, and control of network equipment.
  * Follows designated policies and procedures.
  * Monitors equipment performance and manages regular maintenance and testing to ensure network integrity.
  * Forecasts long-term networking equipment requirements to support strategic initiatives
  * Conducts technical studies and analysis.
  * Develops and implements status reports regarding system activities.
  * Manages contracted vendors by scheduling services; monitoring vendor service and quality levels; conducting quarterly audits of service functions; handling corrective actions; assisting in hiring contractors, negotiating contracts, and setting goals.
  * Manages projects by developing project plans; working in teams; meeting deadlines; keeping parties informed; responding to issues.
  * Maintains client confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential.
  * Provides escalation support for Helpdesk and Desktop Support teams as well as other groups within IT. Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

 **Requirements**

 **Your Qualifications**

  * Bachelor's Degree, or equivalent combination of college and work experience required.
  * Training and certification in one or more leading network operating systems, preferably Cisco IOS.
  * Training and certification on network equipment and protocols.
  * CISCO Certified Network Associate (CCNA) and/or CISCO Certified Networking Professional (CCNP) certifications preferred.
  * 5+ years of experience in a corporate headquarters in Cisco networking is required.
  * 5+ years of experience with Cisco networking products including but not limited to Cisco routers and switches.
  * Experience with Cisco Wi-Fi, Cisco ACI, Cisco ISE and Cisco Prime.
  * Experience in F5 Load Balancers (LTM, GTM, and APM Modules)
  * 3 + years of experience in network security technologies.
  * 3 + years of Palo Alto Networks firewall experience is required
  * 3+ years of experience with Cisco UCS technology is preferable.
  * Ability to network and integrate disparate systems and services into a cohesive system for the organization as a whole.
  * Ability to perform and/or coordinate network related software and hardware changes, including cable terminations and troubleshooting. Strong communication skills, both with internal and external clients
  * Working knowledge of IBM/PC compatible and software applications to the extent necessary to develop and maintain computerized records required. Windows XP, MS Office and MS Access preferred.
  * Working knowledge of IP Telephony/VOIP preferred.
  * Experience in Telecom technologies a plus.
  * Co-Lo/DR architecture and design would be a plus.
  * Working experiences with Microsoft Windows Server products, Active Directory, DNS, DHCP a plus.
  * Networking: Switches, Routers, Hubs, Servers, Cables, Racks, Firewalls, LAN, WAN, TCP/IP, DNS, UDP, Latency, VoIP, QoS, EIGRP, BGP, OSPF, NHRP, ATM, PPP, MPLS
  * Hands-on experience with Cisco Nexus product line switches is a must.
  * Knowledge of Cisco IWAN and/or SD-WAN technology is preferable.
  * Working knowledge of Wireless technology security and communications protocols. CWNA certification preferable but not required.

 **CONDITIONS OF WORK:**

  * Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8am to 5pm. Extended work hours, as needed.
  * May require weekend work for projects or major changes.
  * May require non-traditional work hours when networking systems need attention.
  * May require being part of the on-call rotation schedule.
  * Spends approximately 90% of time in facility.
  * Drives approximately 10% of time to other company locations.

Job Title: Network IP / Linux System Test Engineer
Job Description:
**Senior IP NETWORK TEST ENGINEER**

 **90.00 per hour 1099**  
 **70.00 per hour W2 with Benefit Options, PTO and Holiday pay etc.**

 **EXPERIENCE:**

7+ years of industry experience in test engineering - testing of IP Network
backbone with Linux systems. We are looking for someone who can test the
systems on IP Networks with the Linux systems and do the IP Network and system
Testing; this is not an application tester job. **_Only candidates with strong
IP Network Testing and some Linux system testing need apply._**

 **TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:**

  * Experience with IP Networking protocols and standards
  * Experienced with Linux or other flavors of UNIX operating systems and systems and hardware
  * Experience developing and maintaining comprehensive system test plans for networks and systems- this is not an application tester; we need a system/network tester - in Linux/Unix environments with IP Networks
  * Must have experience with TCP/IP, UDP, sockets, etc. and experience in network performance testing
  * Experienced with IP router performance test tools such as Spirent, NetIQ Chariot, IXIA etc.
  * Scripting experience with Python is a plus
  * Experience in Telecom / Satcom industry is highly preferred

 **Overview:**

Vector continues to fuel its engineering growth and seeks an innovative,
creative Senior Test Engineer who is ready for the challenges,
responsibilities, and rewards that come with working in a high-energy, fast-
paced environment. VT iDirect provides next generation solutions for broadband
IP networking via satellite networks. As the leading innovators in this new
space, our diverse and talented team of Internet, satellite and
telecommunications professionals continues to break new ground and create
significant opportunities for network operators, for service providers and
resellers, and for corporate networking professionals.

Candidates must have a strong technical background and be capable of coming up
to speed on new technologies quickly. Good communication skills, great
problem-solving skills, and the ability to work both individually and
collaboratively in a team environment are required. If you enjoy working in a
fast-paced environment with the smartest team, and the very latest technology,
then this is the job for you!

 **RESPONSIBILITIES**

  * Design, develop, and document comprehensive test plans for all iDirect products.
  * Coordinate and participate in system level testing activities including test planning, execution, and reporting.
  * Perform setup of test scenarios, both hardware and software components, and perform troubleshooting as needed.
  * Validate product features end to end from customer point of view including scale scenarios to ensure a delivery ready product.
  * Troubleshoot the system and gather enough data to enable root cause analysis
  * Evaluate and recommend third-party test tools and other software/hardware products to aid in the system test effort.
  * Attend and participate in system-level design and other meetings to gather data and contribute to continuous improvement of test strategy
  * Create testing tools and scripts as needed to support system level testing activities.
  * Assist our technical writers in the creation of comprehensive product documentation
  * Mentor junior staff as needed
  * Other duties as assigned.

 **QUALIFICATIONS**

 **EDUCATION:**  
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Mathematics,
or equivalent experience  
Master’s Degree is a plus.

 **TECHNICAL EXPERIENCE**

  *  **NOTE; WE ARE NOT LOOKING FOR APPLICATION TESTERS; WE ARE LOOKING FOR A NETWORK IP TESTER WHO CAN TEST THE SYSTEMS AND THE NETWORK. WE ALREADY HAVE THE APPLCIATION TESTERS.**
  *  **Must have o** ver 7 years of industry experience in test engineering.
  * Must have experience with IP Networking protocols and standards and testing of IP Networks.
  * Experience with Linux or other flavors of UNIX
  * Experience developing and maintaining comprehensive system test plans
  * Knowledge of TCP/IP, UDP, sockets, etc. and experience in network performance testing
  * Experience with IP router performance test tools such as Spirent, NetIQ Chariot, IXIA etc.
  * Scripting experience with Python is a plus
  * Experience in Telecom / Satcom industry is highly preferred.
  * Strong verbal and written communications skills.

 **PROFESSIONAL QUALITIES:**

  * Has a ‘can do’ attitude - willing to dive into and take ownership of critical design issues.
  * Demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment.
  * Must be able to analyze and solve technical problems.
  * Must be able to look under the hood to appreciate the low-level functionality of the tools.
  * Must have strong interpersonal skills and be self-motivated.
  * Completes tasks in a timely manner.
  * Communicates effectively on a technical level.
  * Can work under pressure in high visibility situations.
  * Flexible - able to quickly adapt to changing conditions and make decisions based on incomplete data.
  * While we emphasis the ability to work in a team, the candidate must also be effective as a single contributor as the situation warrants.
  * Willing to take direction and follow sound software development processes.

Under limited supervision, the Security and Network Engineer installs,
configures and supports the Authority’s local area network (LAN), wide area
network (WAN), and Internet systems. Responsible for the availability,
reliability, performance, security and maintenance of the Authority’s
Enterprise and SCADA network infrastructure. This includes future design,
implementations and operational support for all security and network related
initiatives as it relates to the Authority. Provides Tier 3 support to the
organization.

 **Duties include but are not limited to:**

Responsible for network maintenance including the daily operations of managing
the BJWSA network, operation of networking components such as switches,
routers, firewalls, access points, hubs, bridges, and transport media (wire,
fiber optic cable, and/or wireless), as well as operation of configuration and
management software tools.

Primary support of the Authority’s enterprise IP network infrastructure as
designed and implemented, including network and security components and
associated equipment.

Designs and/or implements network installations encompassing all aspects of
network installation, including design, budget estimates, planning,
inside/outside plant, post-install inspection, as-built drawings and test
results. Supports Management with network strategies, test systems and develop
system standards.

Monitors network health, security and performance; takes correction action,
when necessary, to ensure optimal response times for users, applications and
systems.

Supports data network equipment such as routers, switches, firewalls, load
balancers, IPS/IDS devices, wireless access points, and other data/IP
networking-related equipment.

Applies strong knowledge of data communications, principles, architectures and
protocols, including TCP/IP, routing, switching, WAN and Ethernet technologies
to design and implement efficient network configurations.

Researches emerging technologies and makes appropriate recommendations to
improve network performance, security and reliability.

Recommends procedures and controls for problem prevention, network or security
related.

Analyzes, reviews, and alters computer systems to maintain and increase
operating efficiency and system resources, minimize support and maintenance or
adapt to new requirements.

Answers operational questions clearly and succinctly, and resolves problems by
applying knowledge of computer software, hardware, and procedures.

Assists with the implementation of the IT Continuity Plan. This plan includes
identification of critical business functions supported by core applications
and hardware with associated recovery time objectives, mitigation strategies,
and resource requirements to ensure IT operational continuity. The plan
addresses cybersecurity and documentation of disaster recovery procedures for
IT datacenters and communications.

Ensures all activities are conducted in an efficient and cost effective manner
in strict conformance with all local, state, and national electric codes, DHEC
standards and established OSHA and Authority safety regulations and policies.  
Identifies equipment specifications and orders IT equipment in accordance with
approved IT budgets.

Performs root cause analysis and develops checklists for typical problems.  
Documents internal policies and/or develops training material for end-users;
this includes network documentation.

Keeps abreast of new developments in field; includes self-study and company
provided training.

Performs other related duties as assigned to ensure effective operation of
department.

 **Requirements:**

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: Requires a Bachelor of Science in Computer
Science or related degree, an Associates Degree in Electronics with five to
seven years’ experience in an IT system or a High School Diploma with seven to
ten years’ experience in IT systems. Experience includes utilizing
troubleshooting techniques and knowledge involving computers, networking,
software, fiber optic networks, security, and communications equipment.
Experience includes managing IT projects. Has in-depth, functional, broad-
based knowledge of security practices and networking. Must be able to
communicate effectively and clearly with all departments and employees to

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS: Must possess and maintain a valid

Job Title: Cloud Network Engineer Virtual Hiring Event
Job Description:
**The Challenge:**

Organizations are looking to modernize legacy expertise networks to software
defined networks but not every network knows how to engineer solutions that
meet all requirements. As a network engineer, you know how to build resilient
networks that takes advantage of the newest technology to include
infrastructure as code, software defined network enterprise, best of breed
internet service provider techniques and networks that connect several
different environments to include the cloud, on premise and disconnected edge.
What if you could use your network engineer skills to improve warfighter
communications? We need you to help us develop network solutions to some of
our customer’s toughest challenges.

As a Network engineer on our team, you’ll develop and sustain multiple secure,
resilient, and highly available networks to support mission critical
operations globally and on the edge. You’ll provide expert level
recommendations and capabilities based on your research of the current
environment and knowledge of various networking technology. Your technical
experience will be vital as you work with your customer to ensure standards
are met throughout the process. This is an opportunity to use the latest
network technologies as you look for ways to improve your customer’s
environment. As a technical leader, you’ll identify new opportunities to build
networking solutions to help your customers meet their evolving needs. Join
our team, as we transform warfighter communications, with networking
technology.

Empower change with us.

**You Have:**

  * Experience with designing, installing, configuration and troubleshooting expeditionary, global, regional and disconnected networks, including internal LAN traffic, WAN, Satellite communications, commercial leased lines, long haul circuits, distributed packet processing, data compression, encryption, and various data transport systems
  * Experience with engineering network capabilities using EIGRP, BGP, DMVPN, Multicast, MPLS, QoS and other WAN based technologies
  * Experience with evaluating projected network usage and reviewing utilization reports
  * Experience with troubleshooting and resolving technical problems with both on-site and remote administrators
  * Ability to communicate technical ideas and deliver briefings with cross functional teams and work at a high demand environment and provide technical expertise on all phases of system engineering activities
  * TS/SCI clearance
  * HS diploma or GED
  * DoD 8570 IAT Level II
  * Ability to obtain CCNP Security certification within 60 days of employment

**Nice If You Have:**

  * Experience with developing tactical, expeditionary cross domain solutions to deliver FMV across different environments, enclaves and networks
  * Experience with Agile development methodologies and working with Agile teams using collaboration tools uses Jira, Confluence, Discourse
  * Experience with analyzing network and bandwidth requirements, conducting requirement analysis, system availability and risk assessment
  * Experience with working with CM tools, including Gitlab, Git-centric and CI/CD workflows
  * Knowledge of network engineering in cloud and disconnected edge environments
  * Knowledge of python scripting, writing Ansible playbooks, rudimentary APIs or automation scripts
  * Knowledge of Infrastructure as Code

**Clearance:**

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need
to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI
clearance is required.

**Technical requirements**

After signing up, you will be sent an email with instructions on how to
connect.  
Please be prepared to join the virtual interview from a quiet place using a
desktop or mobile device with a working speaker, microphone, and camera. Check
to see if your network connection can support an online session. A plugged in
ethernet cable or a strong WiFi network signal will help avoid time delays
during your conversation.

**What to prepare**

  * Resume

**Preferred dress code**

Casual (come as you are, but please be presentable)

**About Booz Allen Hamilton**

For more than 100 years, military, government, and business leaders have
turned to Booz Allen Hamilton to solve their most complex problems. As a
consulting firm with experts in analytics, digital, engineering, and cyber, we
help organizations transform. We are a key partner on some of the most
innovative programs for governments worldwide and trusted by their most
sensitive agencies. We work shoulder to shoulder with clients, using a
mission-first approach to choose the right strategy and technology to help
them realize their vision.

**What is a virtual interview?**

Virtual interviews help employers connect with job seekers when they are not
in the same physical location. Since hiring is a human process, employers
would like to talk with you online (chat, video or phone) to see if you meet
the requirements for the job.

### **About Aston:**

_"Our culture of Innovation, Collaboration, Inspiration and Mentorship is at
the core of our success."_

Aston Technologies has been integrating people with opportunities to learn and
innovate since 2001. Our two decades of excellence have transformed our IT
consulting services into a go-to partner for our clients, with IT projects
nationwide. Aston invests in the latest technologies to empower employees and
instill an innovative culture where learning and career growth are paramount  

  
  

#### **Job Description:**

Aston Technologies is seeking talented individuals that are highly motivated
and eager to launch their career in the IT industry. This role begins with an
on site training program with curriculum designed to test and sharpen your
technical abilities, develop strong professional skills, and familiarize you
on the technologies you will be working with in the field. As a Network
Engineer, you will be working on client network infrastructure and security
projects nationwide to help assess, design, implement, troubleshoot, and
maintain network hardware and software to ensure a successful project
completion.  
  
Upon successful completion of training, you will have a better understanding
in areas like virtual and physical network infrastructure, network security,
application delivery, and cloud network services on a large enterprise scale
on long or short-term job assignments. When on project, network engineers are
expected to solve technical challenges, document solutions, resolve technical
faults, and allocate resources to deliver solutions for the client. We are
looking for people to participate in our in-office and remote training for
this position as soon as May 9th.  

  
  

#### **Requirements:**

Must be able to provide proof of vaccination against COVID-19

General understanding of basic computer terminology and a strong passion to
learn

Basic knowledge and proficiency of Windows OS and Microsoft Office Suite

Ability to effectively and professional convey written and oral communication

Must be open to 100% nationwide travel/relocation to client sites (Currently,
travel is limited due to COVID)

Successful completion of a background checks and drug screens

Must own a reliable vehicle for transportation

Ability to drive to Minneapolis/li>

Ability to train on site in our Minneapolis office (Remote hires may be
required to travel to our offices as needed for the position)

  
  

#### **Training Includes:**

Full time (40hrs/week) paid fast-paced training

Corporate housing package and cost of living stipend provided upon request in
lieu of an hourly rate

Professional development in-house: formal skill-based training, preparation
for future projects, and developmental relationships

Collaborative team environment with peers and mentors every step of the way

Hands on access to state-of-the-art technology from our preferred vendors

1-on-1 mentorship with highly skilled Senior Level Engineers to sharpen your
skills

  
  

#### **On Project Perks and Benefits:**

Pay starts at $20/hour after completing our 3-month paid training program

Up to 20% raises at scheduled checkpoints/ merit-based reviews

Excellent Health, Dental, Vision, and 401(k) with employer match program

7 Paid Federal Holidays

Accrue up to 2 weeks PTO annually after first year on project

Certification Reimbursement (example: CCNA, CCNP, PCNSE, AWS)

**Employer-Provided Benefits When Traveling**

Logistics support team to handle all travel coordination

Furnished housing or lodging

Weekly food stipend

Monthly transportation stipend

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on
revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and
for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to
be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history
- from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to
landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a
pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the
way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and
bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what
others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history,
they're making history.

  
Northrop Grumman's Enterprise Services (ES) organization is seeking an IT
Network Engineer at its Redondo Beach, CA location. This is a full time
Network Engineer position reporting to the Regional Network Operations
Manager, within the ECSN (Enterprise Compute, Storage, and Network) of ES Next
Gen organization. The successful candidate will provide network engineering
and design duties for the NGUSN site networks.

Roles and Responsibilities include:

  * Design, plan and deploy network communications systems.
  * Provides specifications and detailed schematics for NG site network architecture.
  * Provide specific detailed information for network hardware and software selection, including present and future capacity requirements.
  * Provide documentation as required to ensure accurate and current information is available for each site network.
  * Conduct testing of network design.
  * Maintain technical expertise in all areas of network and computer hardware and software interconnection and interfacing, such as routers, firewalls, deep packet inspection analysis, application packet analysis, switches (Nexus and Catalyst), and proxies (Reverse and Forward),etc.
  * Provide guidance to junior engineers and other personnel to maintain and ensure domestic and international data centers are compliant with published directives and procedures.
  * Evaluate and report on new communications technologies to enhance capabilities of the network.
  * Flexible hours are required, with a willingness to work weekends/off hours as needed for planned work or unplanned break/fix support.
  * Lift 40 lbs.
  * Some travel will be required.

Basic Qualifications:

  * Associate’s degree and 11 years of experience; 9 Years of experience with Bachelors in Science; 7 Years with Masters. In lieu of formal education, 13 Years of applied experience will be considered. 
  * Experience with Cisco routers, switches, load-balancers, and firewalls.
  * Experience performing network forensics.
  * Ability to obtain and maintain an active DOD Top Secret clearance.

Preferred Qualifications:

  * Cisco certification
  * Active Top Secret Clearance
  * Experience with F-5, Palo Alto Networks, VMware is a plus.
  * Experience with BGP, OSPF and DNS.
  * Experience with MS PowerPoint and Visio to transform complex technical information into high-level, concise and clear presentations.
  * Experience in project management.

  

  

**Salary Range:** $114,300 USD - $171,500 USD

You will be working with global engineering and product management and hands-

products now and with expansions into the future. Safety and reputation
distinguish the company from the competition and are at the core of values

**Senior Network & Information Security Engineer Salary:** **$85,569 -
$104,822/year** _(dependent upon knowledge, skills, and ability)_  
  
**Position Primary Purpose:**

Responsible for managing, designing, and administrating NWCU's Network and IT
Security platforms. Works with internal teams and vendors to oversee day-to-
day operations of the NWCU Networking and Information Security infrastructure,
as well as developing and maintaining measures to uphold the security of the
organization's systems and information assets.

**Responsibilities:**

  * Leads projects to design, implement, and test network infrastructure and information security systems, and processes.
  * Works with technical teams to ensure that hardware and software infrastructure is maintained with latest firmware and software requirements.
  * Manages basic and expedited support to resolve all networking and cybersecurity related issues.
  * Troubleshoots and resolves all expedited network and cybersecurity issues impacting the customers' challenges and needs..
  * Communicates proactively the status, plan of action(s), and resolution(s) of issues.
  * Monitors and reports the performance and reachability of network components against KPIs and takes preemptive and restorative measures to minimize interruptions as well as isolate and define problem areas.
  * Configures and maintains infrastructure protecting IT systems against unauthorized access, modification, or destruction.
  * Assists management in developing logical, financially responsible, and performant network infrastructure based on industry best practices for a regulated financial institution.
  * Assists in design and implementation of dynamic routing/WAN/LAN and overall network infrastructure.
  * Performs networking interconnectivity and security infrastructure operational tasks in Microsoft Azure and other cloud providers.
  * Assists management in analysis of security systems and applications, and recommends and develops measures to protect information against vulnerabilities, data exfiltration, and unauthorized access.
  * Performs diagnostic analysis of the network system, identifying possible faulty devices, troubleshooting faulty modules, troubleshooting network problems and outages, and prepares necessary documentation detailing actions taken.
  * Performs on-site and telephonic technical services necessary to insure the continuing operation and optimization of the network.
  * Ensures adherence to network and security frameworks based on the NIST 800-53 model and PCI (Payment Card Industry) for a financial institution.
  * All other duties as assigned.

 **Previous Experience:**

A minimum of five (5) years' related work experience in network and system
security is required. Previous financial institution experience is preferred.

**Education:**

High school diploma (GED equivalent) required. Degree in Information
Technology or related curriculum preferred. Certified Information Security
Manager (CISM), and/or Certified Information Systems Security Professional
(CISSP) certifications desired. Cisco Certified Networking Associate (CCNA),
and/or Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) certifications desired.

**Job Summary** ****

The Cybersecurity Solutions Engineer is a role within the Liberty Mutual
Cybersecurity Operations Center responsible for building and implementing new
capabilities for cyber threat hunting, monitoring and identification of
anomalous activity for the Cyber Security Operations Center. Conduct threat
monitoring and hunting while utilizing cyber threat intelligence to expand
capabilities beyond SIEM detections. Utilize threat data to conduct
investigations which may result in security incidents. The role includes
mentoring Senior CSOC engineers through incident response consultation or
through incident escalation. This is a critical front-line cyber security role
responsible for protecting Liberty Mutual' s assets, networks, and systems
from cyber threats.

**Job Responsibilities**

  * Perform threat hunting and risk assessments, conduct incident handling tasks based on daily process and/or procedure.
  * Identify potential security control gaps in an enterprise environment and provide solutions to mitigate compromise. Review threat intelligence to ensure enterprise is prepared to defend attacks.
  * Complete threat assessments to properly scope organizational wide incidents.
  * Conduct threat hunting across the enterprise network to discover indicators of a network breach or system compromise.
  * Comprehensive knowledge of Firewall, IDPS and WAF logs, ability to hunt for threats across the perimeter and across cloud environments. 
  * Incorporate cyber threat intelligence to enhance hunting capabilities. 
  * Investigate alerts generated by network security controls to prevent data loss and maintain the integrity of corporate information.
  * Participate in Financial sector and Information Security communities to share and consume intelligence to further enhance discovery capabilities.
  * Analyze files and binaries for indicators of malicious capabilities resulting in reporting on findings which can be used for retrospective or future detection.
  * Provide mentoring to Senior Cybersecurity Engineers on the processes of advanced information security investigation, threat hunting and incident procedures.
  * Develop applications or scripting for forensic and incident response analysis.
  * Deep understanding of key business initiatives and identifies improvements that address highly complex technical functional and technical gaps within single business process.
  * Provides consultation on highly complex technology to address security gaps which enable business processes. 
  * Ability to lead projects and enhance technology capabilities which support long term strategies
  * Works closely with Security Architects team to drive adaptation of security standards across the organization.
  * Ability to influence change to security posture though data driven analysis 
  * Required 24x7 on-call participation per on-call rotation
  * Apply continuous iteration to current processes and monitoring based on lessons learned. 

**Preparation, Training, and Experience**

  * Collegiate level degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Security, or other related discipline
  * Active Cybersecurity certifications such as GCIH, GSEC, GREM, GCFA, GCFE (GCIH desirable)

  * Previous experience working in a Cyber Security Operations Center is desirable
  * Must have excellent trouble-shooting and problem-solving skills
  * Knowledge of frameworks, standards, and best practices such as NIST, PCI, CIS-CSCs, COBIT, MITRE ATT&CK, Cyberkill Chain etc
  * Demonstrated experience working independently as a digital forensics and incident responder
  * Demonstrated understanding of General IT knowledge, Security Fundamentals, Network Systems, Firewalls, IDS/IPS Systems, Security Email Flow, End-point Security, and, Network Security concepts Windows & Linux Systems Administration, malware analysis, cyber threat hunting, cyber threat intelligence, offensive tactics techniques, and procedures, and cloud security fundamentals.
  * Demonstrated experience with application security.
  * Experience using Security Information Event Management platform/case management.
  * Desirable experience building playbooks, scripts, and development of automation in support of security operations.
  * Excellent oral and written communication skills.

Job Title: Network Cyber Mitigations Engineer/System Vulnerability Analyst (Maryland and Texas Locations)
Job Description:
The NSA Story The National Security Agency (NSA) exists to obtain insight into
foreign adversaries' plans and intentions and protect our U.S. cybersecurity
interests. We provide national security insights and threat warnings to
government decision-makers and eradicate cybersecurity threats. How You Can
Contribute Are you an emerging or seasoned network professional who wants to
work our nation's tough cybersecurity problems? Do you enjoy deeply technical,
hands-on work? Do you want to identify vulnerabilities in network
infrastructure devices and then figure out how to deal with them? Are you
looking to make an impact in cybersecurity and advance your career while
enjoying the outstanding benefits of federal service? Network cyber
mitigations engineers and system vulnerability analysts at NSA analyze
vulnerabilities and develop mitigations to strengthen defenses. They produce
formal and informal reports, briefings, and guidance to defend against attacks
against network infrastructure devices or systems. Our analysts' competencies
run the gamut of data transport possibilities. They work with traditional
wired networks, wireless transport, including Wi-Fi and cellular,
collaborative platforms such as video teleconferencing, and the hardware and
software that support it all. Start your career as a Network Cyber Mitigations
Engineer/System Vulnerability Analyst at NSA, where you can become an expert
in networking protocols and architectures, cloud security, and Internet of
Things protocols, to impact and advance traditional network security.
Responsibilities \- Wired and wireless network security \- Vulnerability
discovery and analysis \- Scalable mitigations development \-
Perimeter/boundary defense \- Collaboration platforms, such as VVoIP and VTC
systems \- Mobile network security \- Tailored security solutions \- Reverse
engineering \- Researching emerging network industry technologies and
solutions \- Control system security \- Malware analysis \- Researching
emerging network industry technologies and solutions \- Ensuring adequacy of
cybersecurity standards and configurations \- Fusing vulnerability assessments
from all sources into a unified picture of network risk. This position has a
Cyberspace Workforce Improvement Program (CWIP) requirement. Candidates
accepted to fill this position will be required to obtain a DoD 8570.01-M
approved certification within six (6) months of assignment. Interested parties
currently pursuing certification are also encouraged to apply. Additional
requirements may be placed against the selectee, based on requirements defined
within DoD 8140.01 and DoD 8570.01-M 'Information Assurance Workforce
Improvement Program."

Job Summary

Are you a cyber professional with the drive and expertise to be on the
forefront of the cyber fight; tackling NSA's complex mission to defend against
cyber threats of today and tomorrow? NSA, the nation's leading cyber agency,
has exciting and challenging positions in Cyber Security Engineering and Cyber
and TEMPEST vulnerability analysis/mitigation. Are you ready to help secure
our Nation's critical Infrastructure? If so, NSA is the place for you!

Qualifications

Competencies

## **Summary**

Posted: Mar 28, 2022

Weekly Hours: **40**

Role Number: **200354057**

Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming
extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring
passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could
accomplish. Come join the Network Team that supports Apple’s Global Backbone!
We're a team of seasoned professionals that provide network design and
deployment services for Apple’s backbone support all of its business units..
We are growing and building the fastest and most reliable backbone network
that’s needed for Apple’s scale and unique needs. The Senior Network Design
and Implementation Engineer will be working in a dynamic and fast-paced work
environment while developing, implementing, and supporting a complex backbone
that spans the Globe. The position requires deep knowledge of backbone network
operations and engineering.

## **Key Qualifications**

    * 6 to 8 years experience with Service Provider network design and support
    * Experience in operating a large scale network using BGP, RSVP, MPLS, ISIS and/or OSPF
    * Solid understanding of TCP/IP (both IPv4/IPv6)
    * Experience and knowledge of Internet Routing Policies and Internet Peering

## **Description**

DESCRIPTION Apple is looking for a Senior Network Design and Implementation
Engineer to join their Global Network Services (GNS) team. The ideal candidate
to fill the Senior Network Engineering position will work in a dynamic team
environment and be responsible for designing and implementing infrastructure
in the Backbone and Internet Edge that includes BGP, MPLS, ISIS, and OSPF in
supporting both our internal and external customers. This engineer will be
developing, implementing, and supporting complex networking solutions to
address a variety of business challenges. The position is responsible
designing, testing, and implementing solutions, as well as validating hardware
functional conformance and software bug identification. The ideal candidate
will collaborate with vendor on bug fixes and new features along with
collaboration with peers in Engineering and Architecture for implementing and
evaluating new technologies and hardware vendors for Apple's network design
requirements. They will need to excel in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
with the ability to multi-task and provide not only operational support but
work closely with peers in Engineering and Architecture for implementing new
technologies. This person must be a collaborative teammate that will work
across multi-functional groups and have the ability and willingness to mentor
others and have a sound business approach for supporting our global footprint.
This person will need to obsess over the customer experience and drive
operational excellence in their everyday work. Besides a deep technical role,
this position also requires strong people skills and an individual who enjoys
the dynamic nature of Apple’s environment.

## **Education & Experience**

College degree (BA or BS) or equivalent work experience

## **Additional Requirements**

  * Advanced Network Certifications preferred
  * Extensive knowledge of at least one vendor CLI of JUNOS, SROS, EOS or IOS/XRS are required
  * Ability to script using Ansible, Python, and Shell a plus

If you are passionate about security this is an opportunity for you to
influence, learn and grow in your career. As part of this team, the individual
will have the opportunity to influence future state towards modernizing
Vanguard's Authentication and Authorization technology stack.

Provides expert level technical support designing, implementing, and
maintaining data center networks and security infrastructure. Identifies,
resolves, or escalates hardware or software issues.

  * Leads, Designs, builds, and maintains APIs in a cloud-based micro-services architecture.

  * End to end process to govern API Access
  * Provide user authorization capabilities using the gateway

  * Lead platform and support existing CA API Gateway (Formerly known as Layer 7) Policy Manager and API security implementation.
  * Collaborate with business and technical team to define API development and integration design requirements
  * Required Strong awareness of latest web standards (OAuth, SAML, OpenID Connect, JWT Tokens, OAuth Tokens & others)
  * Strong knowledge of AWS development/cloud/engineering standard methodologies
  * Familiarity with app containerization using Docker
  * Experience with AWS Lambda, ECS and/or EKS

 **Core Responsibilities**

1\. Plans and implements new security technologies and major releases for the
most critical enterprise-wide IT cloud platform projects. Designs, implements,
and deploys cloud security systems to support and meet business needs.
Identifies, recommends, and implements opportunities for improvement and
performance issue solutions.

2\. Provides expert level technical support and ensures reliable operation of

for cloud computing systems. Contributes to the implementation of leading
security technologies in infrastructure to improve its overall performance.

platforms.

data in cloud computing environments.

schedule. Provides follow up production support. Submits change control

 **About Vanguard**

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because
when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you
invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose –
and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the
right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s
make it count.

 **Inclusion Statement**

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in
our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew
(internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by
one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building
diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as
unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their
distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and
innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core
purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and
to give them the best chance for investment success.

 **Future of Work**

During the pandemic, we transitioned to a work from home model for the
majority of our crew and we continue to interview, hire, and on-board future
crew remotely.

As we have developed the path forward, we have taken a thoughtful approach
that both maximizes the advantages of working remotely and the many benefits
of coming together and collaborating in a shared workspace. We believe that
in-person interactions among our crew are important for preserving our unique
culture and advantageous for the personal development of our crew.

When our Crew return to the office, many will work in our hybrid model. A
smaller proportion of our crew will operate in the Work from Home work model
(for example, field sales crew); or in the Work from Office model (for
example, portfolio managers).

The working model that your role falls into will be communicated to you in the
interview process – please do ask if you are unsure. We encourage you to make
the decision regarding your job interview and offer knowing which model your
role will fall into. We will test and learn as our ways of working evolve and
will continue to evaluate working models along the way.

The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly,
looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve
customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our
team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and
shape the future for the greater good.  
You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical
standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and
accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change
and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength,
and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities. Plus,
Allstate is changing how, when, and where we work-to lead us boldly into our
future. We're empowering our employees to create better ways of working
through more intentional use of communication and collaboration practices,
processes and tools.  
**Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose:** to protect
people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams.
For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s
coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they
face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and
graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice
through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing
sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device
and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We
set them. Job Header:  
Where good people build rewarding careers.  
Think that working in the insurance field can’t be exciting, rewarding and
challenging? Think again. You’ll help us reinvent protection and retirement to
improve customers’ lives. We’ll help you make an impact with our training and
mentoring offerings. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to expand and apply
your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you’ll have fun doing it.
Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and
developing our talents for good, at work and in life. Job Description:  
The Network Engineer Lead is responsible for researching, designing,
documenting, building, testing, deploying, analyzing, administering, and
maintaining the enterprise network environment, including hardware and
software components, to meet current and future business needs. This includes
monitoring and controlling the performance and status of enterprise network
environment technology components and providing network technology component
support and problem resolution. You will need advanced knowledge with
utilizing proven systems, scripting, and developer skills to execute on highly
complex tasks related to hardware and software technology component analysis,
integration, and incident and problem resolution. The role also creates,
reviews, and ensures updates are made to the configuration management plan.  

  * Assists with the following activities (concerning new or existing network hardware and software technology components or enhancements to existing components): research, analysis, selection, planning, document, implement, and train.
  * Collaborates with other Engineers, IT Architects, vendors, and business clients to ensure that modified network hardware and software technology components interact appropriately, data conversion impacts are considered, production environments are developed and maintained, and other areas of impact are addressed and meet business functional and performance requirements.
  * Assists with the execute of highly complex network system changes in support of customer requests.
  * Assists in the efforts to ensure plans integrate effectively with other aspects of the technical hardware and software technology components including representing security standards.
  * Participates in plans at the direction of Sr. Engineers on the team.

**Job Qualifications:**  

  * Education: College degree or equivalent work experience
  * Related experience: 2-3 years of experience with enterprise network systems
  * Experience with LAN switching – Cisco Nexus and Catalyst platforms, particularly Nexus 9k, 7k, 5k, 2k and Cat4500, 3650, 3560X
  * Ability to work with project managers to create project plans, tasks, estimations, schedules, and workflows. Compensation Data

Job Description  
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From
the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a
company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re
committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming,
respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find
your future with us.  
Boeing Commercial Airplanes is seeking Entry Level Product Security Engineers
to join our Product Security Engineering team in either Everett, WA, Seattle,
WA, Renton, WA, P or Tukwila, WA . The selected successful candidates will
work with analysts to develop airplane level security assessments. Ideal
candidates will have knowledge of cyber security concepts and techniques
including network architecture, embedded systems security and PKI
infrastructure. Looking for candidates with strong interest in cybersecurity
and applying cybersecurity concepts to airplane/aircraft applications. You
have an interest in learning to perform and/or utilize complex data analysis
techniques.  
  
**Position Responsibilities:**  
Work on Advanced Security Features development of new concepts and technology
that apply to commercial aviation products (including machine learning, deep
learning & artificial intelligence).  
Assess risks, threats and vulnerabilities of the product assets and production
systems in accordance with accepted industry, professional, and government
standards to ensure security design integrity, availability, confidentiality,
and regulatory compliance.  
Develop security requirements and coordinate with different systems
stakeholders.  
Perform requirements verification on system security engineering products
using inspection, analysis, demonstration, and test methods.  
Coordinate with security testers to validate coverage and impacts to analysis.  
Support airplane certification through coordination with FAA and Engineering
Unit Members  
Provide technical data and develop documentation in accordance with
requirements and system security engineering processes and procedures for
internal reference and external delivery.  
  
This position is expected to be 100% onsite. The selected candidate will be
required to work onsite at one of the listed location options.  
  
This position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a
“US Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. § 120.15 is required. “US Person” includes
US Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.  
  
**Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):**  
Bachelor’s degree or higher in engineering (systems, electrical, computer or
software), cybersecurity or computer science by the end of June 2022.  
  
**Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):**  
Knowledge or coursework in cybersecurity, security network architecture,
embedded systems security, security testing and evaluation, network design,
and PKI infrastructure.  
Knowledge with research and development of cybersecurity system requirements
and cybersecurity system requirements standards.  
Knowledge assessing and detailing test or analysis data to show cybersecurity
compliance.  
Knowledge in systems engineering, systems integration, software engineering,
electrical engineering, certification, network security and/or cybersecurity.  
Knowledge / experience with projects requiring bash scripting or prototyping
skills  
Experience with CISSP, Security+, CEH, CCNA  
Experience with project management  
Coursework, project or experience with Cybersecurity techniques.  
Experience as a UNIX/Linux System administrator, network analyst, or software
developer a plus.  
  
**Typical Education/Experience:**  
Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education
from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science,
mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) or an equivalent combination
of technical education and experience. In the USA, ABET accreditation is the
preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.  
  
**Relocation:**  
This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.

The Network Engineering team within Travelers Infrastructure and Cloud
Services has an exciting opportunity for a Sr. Technology Engineer whose
primary areas of accountabilities to support the tools and services which
maintain DDI and NCCM :

  * \tDaily use and management of the NCCM platform Infoblox NetMRI
  * \tConfiguration, installation, troubleshooting and ongoing maintenance of DDI components, as well as the upkeep of Configuration compliance for network devices providing reports and analytics for management and peers. 
  * \tDevelop and leverage coding and automation skills using Python 

  
The ideal candidate will have a desire, aptitude, and a good level of
practical experience working with DDI technologies, as well as a strong desire
to grow and evolve into a subject matter expert.  
  
Under general supervision, demonstrates a thorough understanding of the
activities performed related to engineering support, installation and/or
operations of infrastructure technologies. Plans at an operational level
designing and developing technology solutions interfacing with appropriate
customers, management and technical resources. Facilitates and/or participates
in the design, development, and implementation of technology solutions
supporting one or more business and/or technology areas. Develops and
implements appropriate solutions that may involve multiple platforms,
databases, software/hardware technologies and tools. Strong ability to multi-
task in an environment of changing priorities.  
  
This position may be based 100% remotely or in one of our offices.  
  
**Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities**

  * Evaluates systems specifications regarding customer requirements, transforming specifications into cost-effective, technically correct solutions.
  * Prioritizes work and manages projects within established budget objectives and customer priorities.
  * Responsible for establishing and managing to established quality control and security protocols.
  * Provides the division, department and business area management with timely and accurate information regarding the status and performance of the assigned project(s).
  * Leverages technology to develop, redesign and/or implement optimal technology solutions.
  * Builds, leverages, and maintains effective alliances across technical and business community.
  * Interacts with customers to achieve efficient, effective results.
  * Multi-tasks, prioritizes according to business priorities and production availability requirements.
  * Other duties as assigned.

 **Minimum Qualifications**

  * A bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or its equivalent in work experience, required.
  * Three years of experience in Technology required.

 **Education, Work Experience, & Knowledge**

  * Five years of experience in Technology preferred.
  * Experience providing technical direction to project teams preferred.
  * Working knowledge of infrastructure technologies such as Network, Database, Server, Storage etc. preferred.

 **Job Specific Technical Skills & Competencies**

  * Advanced knowledge of one or more of the following technical skills:
  * Foundational IT Infrastructure
  * Operating Systems
  * Software
  * Knowledge of process discipline and IDLC methodology

With Apple being the most valuable company globally, mention you could learn a
lot about cutting-edge technology. New innovative ideas have a way of becoming
unique products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Every single
day, people do amazing things at Apple. Do you want to impact billions of
users by developing a unique product with a prime focus on accuracy,
understandability, and performance? Bring passion and dedication to your job,
and there's no telling what you could accomplish! As part of the Enterprise
Network Reliability Team, you will be responsible for the operations,
installation, configuration, integration, and automation of the network
infrastructure across Apple's Enterprise and development network centers
across the AMR region. You will support all corporate Data, wireless,
security, voice, and video application services, including connectivity for
all businesses across Apple. You will demonstrate leadership, collaboration,
and interpersonal skills while working with our various business units. This
role assists the IS&T organization and their peers in delivering excellence,
standardizing, automating, and maintaining our network infrastructure.

## **Key Qualifications**

  * 6 to 8 years of experience in Routing, Switching, Firewall security & Automation
  * Strong knowledge and troubleshooting skills needed in BGP, SDN, OSPF, IPv4/IPv6, MP-BGP, EVPN, VXLAN, SWITCHING, MAB, DOT1X
  * Strong knowledge in analyzing and troubleshooting - Access Control Lists, Multicast. QoS, Wired Technologies, and low latency environment
  * Strong Knowledge in PAN Firewalls - Installing, maintaining security policies and hardware and software upgrades.
  * Strong Automation skills - Python and Ansible.
  * Understanding of Virtualization, NFV, and SDN.
  * Strong analytical and organizational skills along with a professional demeanor.
  * Proven ability to adapt in a dynamic environment and run multiple projects
  * Responding to emergencies and performing effective troubleshooting during production outages.
  * Ability to handle multi vendor products and environment.

## **Description**

Our team owns the AMR Enterprise campus, FSOs, and development infrastructure
across Apple for corporate connectivity services, data, wireless, and firewall
security. We work to understand how all critical applications and services
require consistent connectivity along with SLA/SLO's. We need to have
adaptability for new technology and create strategies to benefit Apple's
growing infrastructure. On our team you will work with many cross functional
internal teams to lead and deliver premier products in an exciting, dynamic
environment! Some day to day responsibilities include: • Ensure operational
perfection across our infrastructure • Work towards standard templates and
automation tasks, ensure project documentation is complete, shared, and
updated periodically • Work closely with Apple's Business units to understand
our application needs for transport end to end • Partner with architecture &
engineering in developing networking standards to meet these business needs
with future development of next-gen systems.

BS degree or equivalent industry experience

## **Additional Requirements**

    * CCIE or equivalent certifications
    * Firewall certification or equivalent experience
    * Participate in on-call (7 x 24) support rotation with other team members.

Job Title: Network IP / Linux System Test Engineer
Job Description:
**Senior IP NETWORK TEST ENGINEER**

 **90.00 per hour 1099**  
 **70.00 per hour W2 with Benefit Options, PTO and Holiday pay etc.**

 **EXPERIENCE:**

7+ years of industry experience in test engineering - testing of IP Network
backbone with Linux systems. We are looking for someone who can test the
systems on IP Networks with the Linux systems and do the IP Network and system
Testing; this is not an application tester job. **_Only candidates with strong
IP Network Testing and some Linux system testing need apply._**

 **TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:**

  * Experience with IP Networking protocols and standards
  * Experienced with Linux or other flavors of UNIX operating systems and systems and hardware
  * Experience developing and maintaining comprehensive system test plans for networks and systems- this is not an application tester; we need a system/network tester - in Linux/Unix environments with IP Networks
  * Must have experience with TCP/IP, UDP, sockets, etc. and experience in network performance testing
  * Experienced with IP router performance test tools such as Spirent, NetIQ Chariot, IXIA etc.
  * Scripting experience with Python is a plus
  * Experience in Telecom / Satcom industry is highly preferred

 **Overview:**

Vector continues to fuel its engineering growth and seeks an innovative,
creative Senior Test Engineer who is ready for the challenges,
responsibilities, and rewards that come with working in a high-energy, fast-
paced environment. VT iDirect provides next generation solutions for broadband
IP networking via satellite networks. As the leading innovators in this new
space, our diverse and talented team of Internet, satellite and
telecommunications professionals continues to break new ground and create
significant opportunities for network operators, for service providers and
resellers, and for corporate networking professionals.

Candidates must have a strong technical background and be capable of coming up
to speed on new technologies quickly. Good communication skills, great
problem-solving skills, and the ability to work both individually and
collaboratively in a team environment are required. If you enjoy working in a
fast-paced environment with the smartest team, and the very latest technology,
then this is the job for you!

 **RESPONSIBILITIES**

  * Design, develop, and document comprehensive test plans for all iDirect products.
  * Coordinate and participate in system level testing activities including test planning, execution, and reporting.
  * Perform setup of test scenarios, both hardware and software components, and perform troubleshooting as needed.
  * Validate product features end to end from customer point of view including scale scenarios to ensure a delivery ready product.
  * Troubleshoot the system and gather enough data to enable root cause analysis
  * Evaluate and recommend third-party test tools and other software/hardware products to aid in the system test effort.
  * Attend and participate in system-level design and other meetings to gather data and contribute to continuous improvement of test strategy
  * Create testing tools and scripts as needed to support system level testing activities.
  * Assist our technical writers in the creation of comprehensive product documentation
  * Mentor junior staff as needed
  * Other duties as assigned.

 **QUALIFICATIONS**

 **EDUCATION:**
