**JOB DUTIES**  
  
25% -  

  * Serves as subject matter expert in the design, specification and operation of Wi-Fi network infrastructure in support of service targets and goals.
  * Serves as an escalation resource in resolution of Wi-Fi trouble reports.
  * Provides technical expertise for the development of documented Wi-Fi system standards, including AP placement guidelines, Wi-Fi equipment specifications, Wi-Fi access controls and metrics for Wi-Fi service validation.
  * Writes reports, work plans, specifications and documentation for technical and non-technical audiences.
  * Consults with Service Manager to determine Wi-Fi service requirements, feasibility, sustainability and communication needs.

  
20% -  

  * Collaborates with network engineers to inform and review technical requirements for Wi-Fi services in the planning and design of network backbone, distribution and access infrastructure.
  * Collaborates with Engineering Construction Management (ECM) staff to inform and review building construction and wiring specifications to assure support for wireless service delivery.
  * Provides cost estimates and planning assistance for Wi-Fi and network components of capital projects to ECM. Collaborates with service management staff to ensure that Wi-Fi service definition and delivery are clear, technically feasible, sustainable and meet program needs.
  * Collaborates with diverse staff and contractors to develop and document effective workflow for Wi-Fi service deployment, validation and maintenance.

  
15% -  

  * Performs routine management of the enterprise IP network.
  * Fills routine requests for IP address information, changes and additions; identifies complex addressing requests and resolves or escalates to engineering staff.
  * Plans, designs, evaluates, procures, implements, maintains and enhances network management tools to achieve management, security and service delivery goals for wired and wireless data, voice and video.
  * Compares and analyzes data from diverse sources to validate consistency of network documentation, device configurations and network management tools.
  * Works directly with colleagues and vendor/manufacturer technical support to isolate and resolve hardware and software issues. Tracks trouble issues and documents resolution.
  * Responds to and resolves escalated network problems in areas of expertise.
  * Communicates status of outages and problem resolution to colleagues and constituents.

  
10% -  

  * Serves as network duty engineer responsible for general network problem determination and resolution during and outside normal business hours.
  * Troubleshoots complex issues in backbone, distribution and access networks and electronics.
  * Performs triage and referral for campus and remote data center problems.

  
10% -  

  * Participates in cross-functional group discussions, activities and efforts.
  * Identifies and selects training opportunities for professional development.
  * Mentors junior staff. Identifies needed training and means of delivering it to support wi-fi service.

  
10% -  

  * Validate that installed Wi-Fi equipment is providing service as promised.
  * Recommend, implement and maintain software and hardware tools for use in planning and performance verification of Wi-Fi infrastructure.
  * Verify that new or modified equipment, configurations and services meet program needs.

  
10% -  

  * Maintain Wireless Access Point location documentation and maps in network management tools, including Cisco DNA Center, Cisco Prime Infrastructure (CPI), Ubiquiti NMS and others.
  * Provide information on expected service coverage and quality by locality for technical staff and for broad campus visibility.

  
ITS Security Statement  
  
Information Technology positions are responsible for the security of UC
Institutional Information and IT Resources. The incumbent is required to
follow all applicable information security policies, procedures, and standards
to maintain minimum standards of information security for data, systems and
applications. Supervisors are responsible for making sure their staff have
appropriate security skills and qualifications, and complete all appropriate
and required security training.  
  
**REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS**  

  * Bachelor's degree in related area and / or equivalent experience / training.
  * Ability to learn effectively and meet deadlines.
  * Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information to technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization.
  * Self-motivated and demonstrated ability to perform self-guided work, and work as part of a team.
  * Demonstrated problem-solving skills of unique issues and problems.
  * Thorough knowledge of, experience with, and ability to design, deploy, manage and troubleshoot wireless network equipment and protocols in a large campus / enterprise environments with hundreds of APs and multiple service offerings.
  * Familiarity with Network Access Control solutions and their implementation, particularly in support of Wi-Fi.
  * Ability to quickly learn the functional and technical aspects of portions of a large, complex campus network infrastructure.
  * Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to communicate effectively with technical and non technical staff at all levels of the organization.
  * Ability to gather, organize and analyze data in the completion of a variety of functional assignments.
  * Ability to resolve issues using established parameters, creativity and independent judgment, escalating as necessary.
  * In-depth experience with network diagnostic and performance management tools and software.
  * Knowledge of IPv4 and IPv6 network transport, routing, naming, addressing, and management protocols such as IEEE 802.11, TCP/IP, DHCP, DHCP6, DNS, SNMP, and OSPF.
  * Thorough knowledge of and experience with implementing, enhancing and using network management systems to monitor current status, characterize network performance and meet service goals.
  * Ability to perform effectively under conditions of fluctuating workload.
  * Knowledge of IT security functions and practices.

  
  
**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**  

  * Working knowledge of databases, SQL and languages such as Python and Perl.
  * Working knowledge of Unix, Linux and/or FreeBSD operating systems, shell scripts and CLI-based network troubleshooting tools.
  * Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with management, colleagues and the UCSC community.
  * CCNP/CCIE Wireless (or equivalent) certification preferred.
  * CWNA/CWAP/CWSP certifications preferred.
  * Agile.
  * Lean / Six Sigma.

  
  
**SPECIAL CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT**  

  * Selected candidate will be required to pass a pre-employment criminal history background check.
  * Must possess a valid license to drive in the State of California.
  * Ability to work long periods of time at a computer with or without accommodation.
  * Incumbent may be required to work nights, weekends and/or holidays.
  * Must be able to respond to after-hours calls on a rotational basis as operationally required.
  * Ability to complete various compliance and job-related training as directed.

of the university’s enterprise wireless network in order to provide next-
generation features improving security, scalability, and customer experience.  
  
\-  
  
**Job Details:**  
General Notes  
  
Information Technology Services is dedicated to supporting the mission of the
University of Texas at Austin of unlocking potential and preparing future
leaders of the state.  
  
One of the essential elements of meeting that mission is valuing diversity in
our recruiting, hiring and retention practices.  
  
We believe the best ideas are born from sharing viewpoints, opinions, and
perceptions from colleagues with varied backgrounds and experiences.  
  
Your skills will make a difference.

research and the work you do will make a difference in the lives of our
students, faculty and staff. If you’re the type of person that wants to know
your work has meaning and impact, you’ll like working for our campus.  
  
The University of Texas at Austin and Information Technology Services provide
an outstanding benefits package to our staff. Those benefits include:

premiums at 50%)

Teachers Retirement System of Texas (a defined benefit retirement plan

a Deferred Compensation program 457(b)

Athletic ticket discounts

**For more details, please see:** https://hr.utexas.edu/prospective/benefits
and https://hr.utexas.edu/current/services/my-total-rewards  
  
Must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any
employer without sponsorship.  
  
This position requires you to maintain internet service and a mobile phone
with voice and data plans to be used when required for work.  
  
This position provides life/work balance with typically a 40-hour work week
and travel limited to training (e.g., conferences/courses). Flexible work
arrangements and some telework are available for this position.  
  
Responsibilities  
Design, build, and operate systems and processes to improve the university’s
enterprise wireless network operations, security, and resilience.  
Collaborate with extended network team to automate infrastructure deployment,
fault detection, operations, and life cycle management.  
Understand end-user needs and create technical solutions utilizing wireless
network technologies for classrooms, R&D labs, and event venues.  
Collaborate on new building and renovation construction projects for wireless
network design.  
Evaluate new wireless network technologies, conduct proof of concepts, run
books definition, and lead pilot deployments.  
Provide escalation support for complex wireless network design and
troubleshooting. Driving university owned vehicles to job sites will be
required for this position.  
**Marginal/incidental:** Maintain acceptable driver rating as established in
Policy UTS157 Section 2.5.4. Other duties as assigned.  
  
Required Qualifications  
5+ years of experience designing, deploying, configuring and operations large
scale wireless networks  
Experience with Cisco wireless controllers and access points or equivalent  
Demonstrated knowledge of IEEE 802.11 standards including .11n and .11ac  
Demonstrated knowledge of wireless security including 802.1x, WPA2, EAP-TLS,
PSK, and PKI  
Demonstrated knowledge of RF site survey, predictive site survey planning, and
optimization  
  
Relevant education and experience may be substituted as appropriate.  
  
Preferred Qualifications  
7+ years of experience designing and operating large scale wireless networks  
3+ years of experience with Cisco wireless controllers and access points  
Demonstrated knowledge of designing and operating high-density Wi-Fi
deployments  
Knowledge of 802.11ax (Wi-Fi 6)  
Experience with mesh networking and/or outdoor wireless  
Experience automating network administration using Python, Ansible, or similar
tools  
Comprehensive understanding of other networking concepts (TCP/IP, Routing and
LAN switching)  
Wireless certifications  
Higher education work experience  
  
Driving Required

Job Title: Cloud Network Engineer Virtual Hiring Event
Job Description:
**The Challenge:**

Organizations are looking to modernize legacy expertise networks to software
defined networks but not every network knows how to engineer solutions that
meet all requirements. As a network engineer, you know how to build resilient
networks that takes advantage of the newest technology to include
infrastructure as code, software defined network enterprise, best of breed
internet service provider techniques and networks that connect several
different environments to include the cloud, on premise and disconnected edge.
What if you could use your network engineer skills to improve warfighter
communications? We need you to help us develop network solutions to some of
our customer’s toughest challenges.

As a Network engineer on our team, you’ll develop and sustain multiple secure,
resilient, and highly available networks to support mission critical
operations globally and on the edge. You’ll provide expert level
recommendations and capabilities based on your research of the current
environment and knowledge of various networking technology. Your technical
experience will be vital as you work with your customer to ensure standards
are met throughout the process. This is an opportunity to use the latest
network technologies as you look for ways to improve your customer’s
environment. As a technical leader, you’ll identify new opportunities to build
networking solutions to help your customers meet their evolving needs. Join
our team, as we transform warfighter communications, with networking
technology.

Empower change with us.

**You Have:**

  * Experience with designing, installing, configuration and troubleshooting expeditionary, global, regional and disconnected networks, including internal LAN traffic, WAN, Satellite communications, commercial leased lines, long haul circuits, distributed packet processing, data compression, encryption, and various data transport systems
  * Experience with engineering network capabilities using EIGRP, BGP, DMVPN, Multicast, MPLS, QoS and other WAN based technologies
  * Experience with evaluating projected network usage and reviewing utilization reports
  * Experience with troubleshooting and resolving technical problems with both on-site and remote administrators
  * Ability to communicate technical ideas and deliver briefings with cross functional teams and work at a high demand environment and provide technical expertise on all phases of system engineering activities
  * TS/SCI clearance
  * HS diploma or GED
  * DoD 8570 IAT Level II
  * Ability to obtain CCNP Security certification within 60 days of employment

**Nice If You Have:**

  * Experience with developing tactical, expeditionary cross domain solutions to deliver FMV across different environments, enclaves and networks
  * Experience with Agile development methodologies and working with Agile teams using collaboration tools uses Jira, Confluence, Discourse
  * Experience with analyzing network and bandwidth requirements, conducting requirement analysis, system availability and risk assessment
  * Experience with working with CM tools, including Gitlab, Git-centric and CI/CD workflows
  * Knowledge of network engineering in cloud and disconnected edge environments
  * Knowledge of python scripting, writing Ansible playbooks, rudimentary APIs or automation scripts
  * Knowledge of Infrastructure as Code

**Clearance:**

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need
to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI
clearance is required.

**Technical requirements**

After signing up, you will be sent an email with instructions on how to
connect.  
Please be prepared to join the virtual interview from a quiet place using a
desktop or mobile device with a working speaker, microphone, and camera. Check
to see if your network connection can support an online session. A plugged in
ethernet cable or a strong WiFi network signal will help avoid time delays
during your conversation.

Virtual interviews help employers connect with job seekers when they are not

RemX is looking for an Active Directory Engineer to help us roll out our
Active Directory Services and Assist the Active Directory (AD) Services Team
to support three major areas: Azure Active Directory, Account Management &
Provisioning and AD Infrastructure & Enterprise Solutions. The AD Engineer
will be expected to lead the Cloud design, create, and maintain a robust,
scalable platform that aligns with the overall cloud strategy of MTI.
Candidate will work alongside network, security, and systems engineers to
implement new Azure/VMware ecosystem solutions.  
  
**Primary Duties and Responsibilities**

  * Assist the Active Directory (AD) Services Team/Architect in support of three areas: Azure Cloud Active Directory, Account Management, and Provisioning, and AD Infrastructure & Enterprise Solutions.
  * Responsible for the end-to-end management and delivery of AD-related projects, including design, implementation, and support of AD and Azure AD, file services, DNS, DHCP and GPO
  * Incident and Escalation Management support for the Active Directory Infrastructure
  * Focus on Active Directory security using Microsoft best practices
  * Troubleshoot issues concerning Active Directory using capabilities of scripting languages for automation
  * Perform vulnerability testing, risk analyses, and security assessments in the Active Directory Environment
  * Support Active Directory management tools, automation's, and backups
  * Resolve and document the business issues and solutions encountered during the migration single forest or multi-forest Active Directory environments
  * Create training manuals and presentation decks to deliver on-site and online training to Active Directory System Administrators
  * Manage multiple priorities, commitments, and projects and interact daily with System Administrators
  * Other duties/projects as assigned

 **Operational Excellence**

  * Actively participates in the implementation of sustainable improvement processes, such as 5S, Kaizen, Daily Management Control, Standard Work and Problem Solving.

 **Qualifications and Experience** :

  * Ten years of relevant experience with a Bachelor's degree in a related field
  * Good experience working with large, complex Active Directory migrations for a company
  * Advanced knowledge in AD architecture and infrastructure (LDAP, Directory Replication, group policy, security, schema changes, domain controller's management).
  * Advanced knowledge of DNS, Kerberos, Windows Authentication and Single Sign-On (SSO)
  * Complete understanding of security principles in the design and operational aspect of Active Directory environments
  * Knowledge of Microsoft Certificate Services/PKI.
  * Demonstrate strong analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills related to Application remediation
  * Advanced knowledge of Windows Server 2012, 2016, and 2019 * Strong TCP/IP networking knowledge
  * Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a team environment and interact with all levels of management as well as customers

  * Knowledge of Identity & Access Management concepts is a plus
  * Knowledge of Privileged Access Management concepts is a plus
  * Knowledge of ADFS and MFA a plus
  * Maintain a strong learning aptitude and ability to learn new technologies independently.

Network Modeling Engineer

ACG Research has developed a unique Business Analytics Engine (BAE) that is
used for business modeling and economic analysis of IT systems that include
networks, data centers, cloud, and edge computing. The primary role of the
Network Modeling Engineer is to use the BAE to work with customers to build
business models. The BAE has a highly intuitive visual interface that creates
economic models by connecting model components. The Network Modeling Engineer
must work closely with ACG’s customers to understand the objectives of the
modeling exercise and understand the dynamics of the systems being modeled.
After understanding the objectives and structure of the model, the engineer
will build the models using the BAE. You must have a strong IT technical
background and also be capable of and interested in constantly learning new
systems, technologies, and architectures. A strong understanding of financial
modeling is a plus but not required since the BAE does most of this analysis
automatically.

 **Job Requirements:**

  * BS degree (or higher) in engineering or computer science
  * 2 years of experience preferably in systems engineering, sales engineering or business development with a vendor or a systems engineering role in a large enterprise or service provider
  * Desire to constantly learn

 **Systems and Technologies:**

Although knowledge and experience in specific technologies is not required,
experience in the following areas would be of great benefit:

  * 5G mobile networks, including RAN, Open RAN, and virtual packet core
  * Private 4G/5G
  * Enterprise networks, including WAN, LAN, and Wi-Fi
  * Virtual edge technologies
  * Network Function Virtualization
  * Data center architectures: computing, storage, and switching
  * Multi-cloud and hybrid cloud
  * Edge computing

## **Job Description:**

  
Leidos is currently looking for a Senior Linux Systems Administrator to join a
long-standing development program. You will enjoy great benefits such as 5
weeks of Paid Time Off, Flexible Schedules, Discounted Stock Purchase Plans,
Unlimited Education and Training Support, Paid Parental Leave, Paid Disability
Leave and much, much more!

 **  
Program Summary:**  
Leidos is currently seeking experienced individuals for exciting opportunities
on a TTO-based contract that supports the customer's Capabilities
organization. One key TTO delivers a platform that hosts an expanding set of
core services, analytic tools, data compliance, and security services to the
TechSIGINT community. Incorporating DevOps, SAFE, and other best practices to
design, develop and deploy software, we adhere to a rigorous release schedule
for the SDK. In addition, we provide software maintenance and enhancements,
systems engineering and administration, and quality assurance to an
operational system of critical importance to SIW. The team works
collaboratively across various organizations implementing the latest
technology (AWS, containerization, DevOps, metrics and monitoring, etc.) to
support the mission and meet the customer's needs in a proactive manner.

Leidos is seeking a Senior Linux Administrator. Additionally the qualified
individual will have significant networking experience including (but not
limited to) Cisco routing and switching to support a Leidos Prime Program in
the development, integration, deployment, and sustainment of critical systems.

 **Position Description:**

Provide support for implementation, troubleshooting and maintenance of
Information Technology (IT) systems. Manage IT system infrastructure and any
processes related to these systems. Provide support to IT systems including
day-to-day operations, monitoring and problem resolution for all of the
client/server/storage/network devices, mobile devices, etc. Act as a SME in
problem identification, diagnosis and resolution of problems. Provide support
for the escalation and communication of status to agency management and
internal customers. Provide support for the dispatch system and hardware
problems and remains involved in the resolution process. Configure and manage
UNIX and Windows operating systems and installs/loads operating system
software, troubleshoots, maintains integrity and configures network components
along with implementing operating systems enhancements to improve reliability
and performance.

 **Responsibilities:**

  * Provide SME on problem identification, diagnosis and resolution of problems
  * Manage the daily activities of configuration and operation of IT systems
  * Provide assistance to users in accessing and using IT systems
  * Provide support to IT systems including day-to-day operations, monitoring and problem resolution for all of the client/server/storage/network devices, mobile devices, etc.
  * Provide support for the escalation and communication of status to agency management and internal customers
  * Optimize system operations and resource utilization, and perform system capacity analysis and planning
  * Provide in-depth experience in trouble-shooting IT systems
  * Provide detailed analysis and feedback to agency management and internal customers forescalated tickets
  * Provide support for the dispatch system and hardware problems and remains involved in the resolution process
  * Configure and manage UNIX and Windows (or other applicable) operating systems and installs/loads operating system software, troubleshoot, maintain integrity of and configure network components, along with implementing operating systems enhancements to improve reliability and performance
  * Networking: routing and switching using Cisco-based products
  * Support the design of systems, mission architecture and associated hardware
  * Possess a working knowledge and understanding of system administration interdependencies as part of the Service Oriented Architecture (SOA)
  * Analyze and resolve complex problems associated with server hardware, applications and software integration

 **  
Basic Qualifications:**

  * TS/SCI w/ Poly clearance required
  * Fifteen (15) years’ experience as a SA in programs and contracts of similar scope, type, and complexity is required. Bachelor’s Degree in a technical discipline from an accredited college or university is required. Five (5) years of additional SA experience may be substituted for a Bachelor’s Degree
  * Well-versed in Linux OS environments
  * Enhanced troubleshooting skills within the server OS as well as both networking and storage technologies
  * Well-versed in networking; routing and switching in Cisco or similar

HarborTech Mobility is actively seeking a Network and Security Engineer to
join our fast-growing team! The network and security professional services
team designs and builds WLAN and LAN solutions that scale to support large
customers across the country. We are looking for technologists with broad
expertise who can provide a high standard of collaboration, mentorship and
solutions to complex problems.

 **Duties and Responsibilities:**

\- - Provide Professional Services to HarborTech Mobility’s clients to design,
architect, plan, implement and test of enterprise network and security
solutions.

\- Hands on design and configuration of LANs and firewalls incorporating best
practices and industry standard tools to tune and optimize systems for
immediate customer use.

\- Provide Professional Services Projects to design and deploy AAA & NAC
systems for secure access.

\- Guarantee network security best practices are executed through auditing.

\- Provide Tier 3 support and work occasionally with the NOC team to
troubleshoot and resolve complex LAN and security technical incidents.

\- Assist the sales team during the Pre-Sales process by serving as a
technical consultant.

\- Produce engineering documents (network diagrams, testing procedures, audit
reports, etc.)

\- Utilize excellent listening skills and strong written and spoken
communications skills to enhance efficient project deliveries.

\- Work outside normal business hours when required - scheduled maintenance,
outage response, last minute urgent requests

Networks, Fortinet, Cisco Systems, or equivalent combination of those
technologies

integrating and supporting the network security with Palo Alto, Cisco ASA
and/or Fortinet. (Not all are needed but the more you have, the more
advantages you accrue in securing a job)

o Good knowledge of networking concepts, routing and switching technologies,
WAN connectivity and transport types and protocols

o Developing and implementing wired and wireless Access & Control Systems
(Aruba ClearPass, Cisco ISE, Microsoft NPS)

o Switching technologies and protocols (VLANs, STP, LACP, Stacking, VRRP/HSRP,
static routing, etc.)

\- Knowledge of IPSec and SSL VPNs

\- Experience with protocol analysis tools and network management systems

\- Ability to create detailed documentation and diagrams to reflect processes,
traffic flows and network architectures

\- Must be able to quickly learn and apply new technologies

\- Excellent organizational skills and multi-tasking ability

\- Must be able to travel to customer sites if required (25% of time on
average)

\- Excellent oral and written communication skills

\- Ability to succeed in a dynamic and fast-paced environment

\- Customer focused and results oriented

PCNSE, Fortinet NSE4 or higher, Cisco CCNP, etc. are highly desired

\- Experience working with Microsoft Active Directory and VMWare

\- Consulting Experience

 **Benefits:**

across US

\- Paid holidays

We are GDIT. We support and secure some of the most complex government,
defense, and intelligence projects across the country. At GDIT, cyber security
is not just a singular part of our mission—it connects every one of us because
it’s embedded into every aspect of what we do.

We are seeking a Cloud Security Engineer to support the National Library of
Medicine (NLM) in Bethesda, Maryland.

At GDIT, people are our differentiator. As a Cloud Security Engineer
supporting the National Library of Medicine, you will be trusted to work on
commercial clouds to secure the configuration management of NLM applications.
In this role, a typical day will include:

  * Developing and deploying infrastructure as a code scripts to implement and optimize security controls and mechanisms of a cloud infrastructure
  * Acting as the subject matter expert for cloud security and tools such as Security Information and Event Management (SIEM), access control mechanisms, Intrusion Detection and Intrusion Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS).
  * Monitoring Cloud infrastructure and pro-actively mitigate potential incidents before service degradation occurs
  * Providing guidance to our DevOps teams developing on public cloud platforms, advising on security standards for cloud deployment, and working to identify common patterns for template provisioning
  * Conducting assessments of security controls for new and existing cloud systems; creating and maintaining as-built system documentation, architecture diagrams, and online collaborative documentation
  * Determining security modes of operation and recommending new or revised security measures and countermeasures for current security challenges
  * Collaborating with other NLM team members to continue to evolve and implement a state-of-the-art secure cloud infrastructure.

 **REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:**

  * BS/BA (or equivalent) and 8 years experience or a MS and 6 years experience
  * Contract requirement: 7 years of overall IT experience with degree; 11 years without degree; 5 years with MS. Also 5 years of system administration experience; 5 years of system security administration experience
  * Experience in designing and implementing an enterprise-wide Cloud security architecture
  * Proficiency with SIEM and vulnerability management solutions
  * Experience using common networking tools to aid in troubleshooting, including nmap, Wireshark, tcpdump, etc.
  * Proficiency in one or more scripting languages, such as Python, Perl, Powershell, OR Bash
  * Proficiency with TCP/IP/UDP ports and protocols, IDS/IPS, Network Access Control List (NACL) Access Control Lists (ACL) and Security Group (SG) applications

  * Must have CISSP or ability to obtain within first six months of employment
  * Must have strong written and verbal communications skills
  * Ability to obtain Level 2 Secret (ANACI) clearance if required

 **PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:**

  * Experience in creating and editing AWS Cloud Formation scripts
  * Experience in securing and monitoring Kubernetes
  * Experience in managing, and monitoring a centralized AWS logging architecture
  * AWS Certified Security - Specialty, ISC2, or Cloud Security Alliance

 **WHAT GDIT CAN OFFER YOU:**

  * Full-flex work week
  * 401K with company match
  * Internal mobility team dedicated to helping you own your career
  * Collaborative teams of highly motivated critical thinkers and innovators
  * Ability to make a real impact on the world around you

**NOAA - NWS**

Network Engineer

Honolulu, HI

 ** _GENERAL JOB DESCRIPTION_**

1) Wide Area Network (WAN) Services  
The candidate will manage and provide services as follows:

  * WAN services include the evaluation, design, deployment (installation, configuration, provisioning), testing, monitoring, security, administration and reporting of networks that interconnect two or more separate facilities that span a geographic area larger than a campus or metropolitan area.
  * Transmission facilities services shall include, but are not limited to, dedicated Internet connections, Internet‐based VPNs, MPLS, and dial‐up connections. The contractor shall work with public carriers and other Government circuit providers on behalf of the NWS Pacific Region to ensure delivery of WAN services.
  * Support of any network services‐related work required by designated carriers, to support the NWS Pacific Region network, is considered within the scope of services.

2) Local Area Network (LAN) Services  
The candidate will manage and provide LAN services including the evaluation,
design, deployment (installation, configuration, provisioning), testing,
monitoring, security, administration and reporting of networks that are
usually confined to a single facility or portion of a facility. LAN components
including LANs supporting all network traffic originating from desktop
devices, local file and print servers, application servers, database servers,
peripherals, firewalls/routers, other network devices and other user premise
devices. This service ends at, but does not include, the LAN attached to the
device network card at the desktop.

3) Steady-State Corrective Maintenance  
The candidate will manage and provide Steady-state corrective maintenance that
is performed at unpredictable intervals. The objective of corrective
maintenance is to restore the system to satisfactory operation within the
shortest possible time. Steady-state corrective maintenance consists of the
following action(s):

  * Restore a failed system to operational status. This usually involves replacing or repairing the software or hardware component that is responsible for the failure in the system.
  * Action to make configuration changes or other fixes conducted under a Steady-State Corrective Maintenance Work Request may require application configuration change to implement into production.
  * Action taken to ensure continuing operations for hardware/software version/platform/infrastructure changes (e.g. operating system upgrades) when the impacted business application/system would otherwise not work as a direct result of that version/platform/infrastructure change.

 ** _QUALIFICATIONS FOR THE JOB_**

**Senior Network & Information Security Engineer Salary:** **$85,569 -
$104,822/year** _(dependent upon knowledge, skills, and ability)_  
  
**Position Primary Purpose:**

Responsible for managing, designing, and administrating NWCU's Network and IT
Security platforms. Works with internal teams and vendors to oversee day-to-
day operations of the NWCU Networking and Information Security infrastructure,
as well as developing and maintaining measures to uphold the security of the
organization's systems and information assets.

**Responsibilities:**

  * Leads projects to design, implement, and test network infrastructure and information security systems, and processes.
  * Works with technical teams to ensure that hardware and software infrastructure is maintained with latest firmware and software requirements.
  * Manages basic and expedited support to resolve all networking and cybersecurity related issues.
  * Troubleshoots and resolves all expedited network and cybersecurity issues impacting the customers' challenges and needs..
  * Communicates proactively the status, plan of action(s), and resolution(s) of issues.
  * Monitors and reports the performance and reachability of network components against KPIs and takes preemptive and restorative measures to minimize interruptions as well as isolate and define problem areas.
  * Configures and maintains infrastructure protecting IT systems against unauthorized access, modification, or destruction.
  * Assists management in developing logical, financially responsible, and performant network infrastructure based on industry best practices for a regulated financial institution.
  * Assists in design and implementation of dynamic routing/WAN/LAN and overall network infrastructure.
  * Performs networking interconnectivity and security infrastructure operational tasks in Microsoft Azure and other cloud providers.
  * Assists management in analysis of security systems and applications, and recommends and develops measures to protect information against vulnerabilities, data exfiltration, and unauthorized access.
  * Performs diagnostic analysis of the network system, identifying possible faulty devices, troubleshooting faulty modules, troubleshooting network problems and outages, and prepares necessary documentation detailing actions taken.
  * Performs on-site and telephonic technical services necessary to insure the continuing operation and optimization of the network.
  * Ensures adherence to network and security frameworks based on the NIST 800-53 model and PCI (Payment Card Industry) for a financial institution.
  * All other duties as assigned.

 **Previous Experience:**

A minimum of five (5) years' related work experience in network and system
security is required. Previous financial institution experience is preferred.

**Education:**

High school diploma (GED equivalent) required. Degree in Information
Technology or related curriculum preferred. Certified Information Security
Manager (CISM), and/or Certified Information Systems Security Professional
(CISSP) certifications desired. Cisco Certified Networking Associate (CCNA),
and/or Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) certifications desired.
Training in ITIL/IT Service Management processes is desired.

 **Demonstrated Abilities:**

  * Familiarity with NIST 800-53, PCI and CIS Controls Frameworks.
  * Experience administrating and managing firewall technologies such as Palo Alto, Cisco, and Checkpoint.
  * Experience administrating Virtual Private Networking solutions for third-party connectivity.
  * Experience administrating and managing Cisco Systems routing and switching technologies.
  * Experience or equivalent certification with Azure Networking and Firewalling concepts.
  * Experience with Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) technologies.
  * Experience managing and deploying WAN technologies based on standard routing protocols.
  * Experience and/or familiarity with data loss prevention technologies, intrusion detection/prevention platforms, vulnerability scanning systems, secure email gateways, and other similar security technologies.
  * Strong commitment to continuous education on networking concepts and cyber security education.
  * Able to identify, prioritize, and solve complex network-related problems.
  * Able to work in a fast paced complex and dynamic environment.
  * Poise under pressure and comfort with ambiguity.
  * Outstanding analytical, verbal and written skills.
  * Experience with writing system and process documentation.
  * Ability to remain highly adaptable in a growing organization.
  * Experience implementing security standards, policies and procedures.
  * In-depth knowledge of the OSI model.

**ABOUT UC SANTA CRUZ**  
  
UC Santa Cruz is a public university like no other in California, combining
the experience of a small, liberal arts college with the depth and rigor of a
major research university. It's known as an unconventional place where
innovation and experimentation is part of the campus's DNA. That playful, bold
spirit still thrives today, all on a campus renowned as among the most
beautiful in the world.  
  
**DEPARTMENT OVERVIEW**  
  
Information Technology Services (ITS) is the campus innovation nexus that
supports and amplifies the value of research, teaching, learning, and digital
experiences at UC Santa Cruz. We are a group of diverse, enthusiastic people
who produce extraordinary results that foster a campus climate where employees
feel a sense of belonging.  
  
Our guiding principles are integrity, client focus, teamwork, knowledge, and
fulfillment. We are looking for people who are deeply curious, hard-working,
ambitious, kind, and deeply committed to inclusive excellence.  
  
We aspire to operate in an Agile and Lean fashion. Our goal is to continually
improve our service quality, experience, and value to our constituents. We
care deeply about creating a diverse, high performing organization through
recruiting while developing highly talented, well-rounded, staff. We invest in
career paths and career development, devoting a significant amount of
resources to skill and professional development for our staff.  
  
ITS promotes two areas for skill growth:  
  
1\. Developing generalizing specialists by focusing on technical depth and
breadth  
  
2\. Growing service and product expertise  
-  
  
ITS - Network Engineering is responsible for managing consolidated IT network
resources and for providing a secure and stable computing environment for the
campus. Responsibilities include academic and residential network access for
wired and wireless devices at main campus and remote sites, backbone
administration, CENIC connection and tunnels, network security, VPN services
for remote access and site-to-site links, traffic management,
telecommunications management and Data Center operations at campus and remote
sites.  
  
More information can be found at https://its.ucsc.edu  
  
**JOB SUMMARY**  
  
This position applies advanced professional communications concepts, industry
practices and relevant policies, procedures and goals to resolve highly
complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth
evaluation of variable factors. The person in this position chooses methods,
techniques, and evaluation criteria to obtain results.  
  
Serves as subject matter expert and technical lead in defining standards,
selecting equipment and achieving sustainable administration of Wi-Fi
infrastructure supporting a rapidly expanding wireless service, comprising
thousands of Wireless Access Points (WAPs) and expected to grow.  
  
Serves as a technical lead and escalation resource for the Network Operations
group, contributing to reliable and secure ongoing operation of the enterprise
IP network in support of wireless and wired data, voice and video/TV services.
Researches, recommends, implements, documents, monitors, maintains and
troubleshoots network infrastructure and management systems for consistent and
sustainable service delivery. Contributes technical expertise in the
development and documentation of operational standards and procedures.

ITS Security Statement  
  
Information Technology positions are responsible for the security of UC
Institutional Information and IT Resources. The incumbent is required to
follow all applicable information security policies, procedures, and standards
to maintain minimum standards of information security for data, systems and
applications. Supervisors are responsible for making sure their staff have
appropriate security skills and qualifications, and complete all appropriate
and required security training.  
  
**REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS**  

  * Bachelor's degree in related area and / or equivalent experience / training.
  * Ability to learn effectively and meet deadlines.
  * Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information to technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization.
  * Self-motivated and demonstrated ability to perform self-guided work, and work as part of a team.
  * Demonstrated problem-solving skills of unique issues and problems.
  * Thorough knowledge of, experience with, and ability to design, deploy, manage and troubleshoot wireless network equipment and protocols in a large campus / enterprise environments with hundreds of APs and multiple service offerings.
  * Familiarity with Network Access Control solutions and their implementation, particularly in support of Wi-Fi.
  * Ability to quickly learn the functional and technical aspects of portions of a large, complex campus network infrastructure.
  * Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to communicate effectively with technical and non technical staff at all levels of the organization.
  * Ability to gather, organize and analyze data in the completion of a variety of functional assignments.
  * Ability to resolve issues using established parameters, creativity and independent judgment, escalating as necessary.
  * In-depth experience with network diagnostic and performance management tools and software.
  * Knowledge of IPv4 and IPv6 network transport, routing, naming, addressing, and management protocols such as IEEE 802.11, TCP/IP, DHCP, DHCP6, DNS, SNMP, and OSPF.
  * Thorough knowledge of and experience with implementing, enhancing and using network management systems to monitor current status, characterize network performance and meet service goals.
  * Ability to perform effectively under conditions of fluctuating workload.
  * Knowledge of IT security functions and practices.

  * Working knowledge of databases, SQL and languages such as Python and Perl.

  * Agile.

Job Title: Cloud Network Engineer Virtual Hiring Event
Job Description:
**The Challenge:**

Organizations are looking to modernize legacy expertise networks to software
defined networks but not every network knows how to engineer solutions that
meet all requirements. As a network engineer, you know how to build resilient
networks that takes advantage of the newest technology to include
infrastructure as code, software defined network enterprise, best of breed
internet service provider techniques and networks that connect several
different environments to include the cloud, on premise and disconnected edge.
What if you could use your network engineer skills to improve warfighter
communications? We need you to help us develop network solutions to some of
our customer’s toughest challenges.

As a Network engineer on our team, you’ll develop and sustain multiple secure,
resilient, and highly available networks to support mission critical
operations globally and on the edge. You’ll provide expert level
recommendations and capabilities based on your research of the current
environment and knowledge of various networking technology. Your technical
experience will be vital as you work with your customer to ensure standards
are met throughout the process. This is an opportunity to use the latest
network technologies as you look for ways to improve your customer’s
environment. As a technical leader, you’ll identify new opportunities to build
networking solutions to help your customers meet their evolving needs. Join
our team, as we transform warfighter communications, with networking
technology.

Empower change with us.

**You Have:**

  * Experience with designing, installing, configuration and troubleshooting expeditionary, global, regional and disconnected networks, including internal LAN traffic, WAN, Satellite communications, commercial leased lines, long haul circuits, distributed packet processing, data compression, encryption, and various data transport systems
  * Experience with engineering network capabilities using EIGRP, BGP, DMVPN, Multicast, MPLS, QoS and other WAN based technologies
  * Experience with evaluating projected network usage and reviewing utilization reports
  * Experience with troubleshooting and resolving technical problems with both on-site and remote administrators
  * Ability to communicate technical ideas and deliver briefings with cross functional teams and work at a high demand environment and provide technical expertise on all phases of system engineering activities
  * TS/SCI clearance
  * HS diploma or GED
  * DoD 8570 IAT Level II
  * Ability to obtain CCNP Security certification within 60 days of employment

**Nice If You Have:**

  * Experience with developing tactical, expeditionary cross domain solutions to deliver FMV across different environments, enclaves and networks
  * Experience with Agile development methodologies and working with Agile teams using collaboration tools uses Jira, Confluence, Discourse
  * Experience with analyzing network and bandwidth requirements, conducting requirement analysis, system availability and risk assessment
  * Experience with working with CM tools, including Gitlab, Git-centric and CI/CD workflows
  * Knowledge of network engineering in cloud and disconnected edge environments
  * Knowledge of python scripting, writing Ansible playbooks, rudimentary APIs or automation scripts
  * Knowledge of Infrastructure as Code

**Clearance:**

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need
to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI
clearance is required.

**Technical requirements**

After signing up, you will be sent an email with instructions on how to
connect.  
Please be prepared to join the virtual interview from a quiet place using a
desktop or mobile device with a working speaker, microphone, and camera. Check
to see if your network connection can support an online session. A plugged in
ethernet cable or a strong WiFi network signal will help avoid time delays
during your conversation.

For more than 100 years, military, government, and business leaders have
turned to Booz Allen Hamilton to solve their most complex problems. As a

in the same physical location. Since hiring is a human process, employers

the requirements for the job.

Network Modeling Engineer

ACG Research has developed a unique Business Analytics Engine (BAE) that is
used for business modeling and economic analysis of IT systems that include
networks, data centers, cloud, and edge computing. The primary role of the
Network Modeling Engineer is to use the BAE to work with customers to build
business models. The BAE has a highly intuitive visual interface that creates
economic models by connecting model components. The Network Modeling Engineer
must work closely with ACG’s customers to understand the objectives of the
modeling exercise and understand the dynamics of the systems being modeled.
After understanding the objectives and structure of the model, the engineer
will build the models using the BAE. You must have a strong IT technical
background and also be capable of and interested in constantly learning new
systems, technologies, and architectures. A strong understanding of financial

 **  
Program Summary:**  
Leidos is currently seeking experienced individuals for exciting opportunities
on a TTO-based contract that supports the customer's Capabilities
organization. One key TTO delivers a platform that hosts an expanding set of
core services, analytic tools, data compliance, and security services to the
TechSIGINT community. Incorporating DevOps, SAFE, and other best practices to
design, develop and deploy software, we adhere to a rigorous release schedule
for the SDK. In addition, we provide software maintenance and enhancements,
systems engineering and administration, and quality assurance to an
operational system of critical importance to SIW. The team works
collaboratively across various organizations implementing the latest
technology (AWS, containerization, DevOps, metrics and monitoring, etc.) to
support the mission and meet the customer's needs in a proactive manner.

Leidos is seeking a Senior Linux Administrator. Additionally the qualified
individual will have significant networking experience including (but not
limited to) Cisco routing and switching to support a Leidos Prime Program in
the development, integration, deployment, and sustainment of critical systems.

 **Position Description:**

Provide support for implementation, troubleshooting and maintenance of
Information Technology (IT) systems. Manage IT system infrastructure and any
processes related to these systems. Provide support to IT systems including
day-to-day operations, monitoring and problem resolution for all of the
client/server/storage/network devices, mobile devices, etc. Act as a SME in

for the escalation and communication of status to agency management and
internal customers. Provide support for the dispatch system and hardware
problems and remains involved in the resolution process. Configure and manage

and performance.

  * Provide in-depth experience in trouble-shooting IT systems
  * Provide detailed analysis and feedback to agency management and internal customers forescalated tickets
  * Provide support for the dispatch system and hardware problems and remains involved in the resolution process
  * Configure and manage UNIX and Windows (or other applicable) operating systems and installs/loads operating system software, troubleshoot, maintain integrity of and configure network components, along with implementing operating systems enhancements to improve reliability and performance
  * Networking: routing and switching using Cisco-based products

  * Possess a working knowledge and understanding of system administration interdependencies as part of the Service Oriented Architecture (SOA)
  * Analyze and resolve complex problems associated with server hardware, applications and software integration

Bachelor’s Degree in a technical discipline from an accredited college or university is required. Five (5) years of additional SA experience may be substituted for a Bachelor’s Degree

**NOAA - NWS**

Network Engineer

Honolulu, HI

 ** _GENERAL JOB DESCRIPTION_**

1) Wide Area Network (WAN) Services  
The candidate will manage and provide services as follows:

  * WAN services include the evaluation, design, deployment (installation, configuration, provisioning), testing, monitoring, security, administration and reporting of networks that interconnect two or more separate facilities that span a geographic area larger than a campus or metropolitan area.
  * Transmission facilities services shall include, but are not limited to, dedicated Internet connections, Internet‐based VPNs, MPLS, and dial‐up connections. The contractor shall work with public carriers and other Government circuit providers on behalf of the NWS Pacific Region to ensure delivery of WAN services.
  * Support of any network services‐related work required by designated carriers, to support the NWS Pacific Region network, is considered within the scope of services.

2) Local Area Network (LAN) Services  
The candidate will manage and provide LAN services including the evaluation,
design, deployment (installation, configuration, provisioning), testing,
monitoring, security, administration and reporting of networks that are
usually confined to a single facility or portion of a facility. LAN components
including LANs supporting all network traffic originating from desktop
devices, local file and print servers, application servers, database servers,
peripherals, firewalls/routers, other network devices and other user premise
devices. This service ends at, but does not include, the LAN attached to the
device network card at the desktop.

3) Steady-State Corrective Maintenance  
The candidate will manage and provide Steady-state corrective maintenance that
is performed at unpredictable intervals. The objective of corrective
maintenance is to restore the system to satisfactory operation within the
shortest possible time. Steady-state corrective maintenance consists of the
following action(s):

  * Restore a failed system to operational status. This usually involves replacing or repairing the software or hardware component that is responsible for the failure in the system.
  * Action to make configuration changes or other fixes conducted under a Steady-State Corrective Maintenance Work Request may require application configuration change to implement into production.
  * Action taken to ensure continuing operations for hardware/software version/platform/infrastructure changes (e.g. operating system upgrades) when the impacted business application/system would otherwise not work as a direct result of that version/platform/infrastructure change.

 ** _QUALIFICATIONS FOR THE JOB_**

  * Minimum five (5) years of experience as a network engineer.
  * Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) Certification
  * Experience in planning, procurement, designing, developing, configuring and commissioning federal networks and associated systems for network monitoring and incident management.
  * Experience with Federal Government network documentation and policy design/compliance.
  * Ability to analyze, evaluate and monitor network infrastructure to ensure networks are configured to operate at optimal performance.
  * Expert in troubleshooting and diagnosing network problems, and determining the most appropriate means of resolving problems and issues to improve network performance.
  * Enhanced ability to monitor the overall performance of systems to assess the need for updates, upgrades, enhancements, preventive maintenance and new systems, and recommending options for upgrading and improving the performance of systems.
  * Ability to plan and communicate the steps needed to deliver a defined outcome.
  * Ability to evaluate and document the business case for a defined initiative.
  * Ability to view overall business priorities and redefine own and team’s priorities in line with expectations and objectives.
  * Ability to ensure most urgent and important needs of the business are achieved.
  * Ability to summarize technical information into a format suitable for senior management reporting without losing the essence of the information

 ** _HIGHLY DESIRED SKILLS_**

Environment: The network operates in Linux, Windows and Mac environments.
Network equipment includes but is  
not limited to routers, switches, VPN, remote support, firewalls, and out-of-
band management and wireless infrastructure.

The systems leverage commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) products, and government
off-the-shelf (GOTS) applications (locally developed applications and
corporate applications). This environment supports infrastructure providing
network connectivity to approximately 250 workstations.

About OpsTech IT  
The Global OpsTech IT Network Operation Center (NOC) team is responsible for
24X7 monitoring the infrastructure and will serve as an initiator for all High
Severity Events (HSEs), Multiple Severity Events (MSEs), and Large Scale
Events (LSEs). Your peers will be system and software support engineers
working to ensure Fulfillment Center systems are healthy and available to meet
customer demands. As a member of NOC you will be part of a world-class team in
a fast-paced environment that has the entrepreneurial feel of a start-up.  
  
About The Role  
As a Network Operation Center Engineer on the Global OpsTech IT Network
Operation Center (NOC) team you will also serve as a central monitoring
location for the OpsTech IT supported sites, IT and non-IT systems impacting
Operations. You will have knowledge in evaluation of network performance,
detailed knowledge in Server functions. In this role you will have the
opportunity to participate in solutions to business problems that are truly
unique to Amazon. This is a global team and strong communication skills are a
must. This role will contribute and build a support and process model which
will impact Amazon at a global level.  
  
Responsibilities Include, but are not limited to:  

  * Monitor, analyze, track and escalate critical events
  * Invoke protocol alerting
  * Swift assignment to support organization
  * Correlate multiple events
  * Lead proactive investigations
  * Implement changes to avert future risk
  * Assist in process improvements for Global Operations Teams

###  **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**

  * High School or equivalent diploma
  * 3+ years IT experience with client, server, and network service delivery
  * 4+ years of hands on IT systems or relevant experience in a commercial production environment
  * 4+ years of experience with networking concepts such as DNS, DHCP, SSL, OSI Model, and TCP/IP
  * 4+ years of experience in each of the following: Microsoft Administration, Linux Administration, or Cisco IOS (CLI)
  * 4+ years of experience troubleshooting skills in a multi-user high availability environment
  * 4+ years of experience in PC repair, troubleshooting, deployment, and liquidation

###  **PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**

  * Bachelor’s degree in Computer science or IT related field
  * Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert and Microsoft Certified IT Professional Systems Administrator Certifications
  * Strong troubleshooting skills of very complex systems
  * Ability to explain complex IT concepts in simple terms
  * Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  * Ability to manage high priority projects

**Position Primary Purpose:**

Responsible for managing, designing, and administrating NWCU's Network and IT
Security platforms. Works with internal teams and vendors to oversee day-to-
day operations of the NWCU Networking and Information Security infrastructure,
as well as developing and maintaining measures to uphold the security of the
organization's systems and information assets.

**Responsibilities:**

  * Leads projects to design, implement, and test network infrastructure and information security systems, and processes.
  * Works with technical teams to ensure that hardware and software infrastructure is maintained with latest firmware and software requirements.
  * Manages basic and expedited support to resolve all networking and cybersecurity related issues.
  * Troubleshoots and resolves all expedited network and cybersecurity issues impacting the customers' challenges and needs..
  * Communicates proactively the status, plan of action(s), and resolution(s) of issues.
  * Monitors and reports the performance and reachability of network components against KPIs and takes preemptive and restorative measures to minimize interruptions as well as isolate and define problem areas.
  * Configures and maintains infrastructure protecting IT systems against unauthorized access, modification, or destruction.
  * Assists management in developing logical, financially responsible, and performant network infrastructure based on industry best practices for a regulated financial institution.
  * Assists in design and implementation of dynamic routing/WAN/LAN and overall network infrastructure.
  * Performs networking interconnectivity and security infrastructure operational tasks in Microsoft Azure and other cloud providers.
  * Assists management in analysis of security systems and applications, and recommends and develops measures to protect information against vulnerabilities, data exfiltration, and unauthorized access.
  * Performs diagnostic analysis of the network system, identifying possible faulty devices, troubleshooting faulty modules, troubleshooting network problems and outages, and prepares necessary documentation detailing actions taken.
  * Performs on-site and telephonic technical services necessary to insure the continuing operation and optimization of the network.
  * Ensures adherence to network and security frameworks based on the NIST 800-53 model and PCI (Payment Card Industry) for a financial institution.
  * All other duties as assigned.

 **Previous Experience:**

A minimum of five (5) years' related work experience in network and system
security is required. Previous financial institution experience is preferred.

**Education:**

High school diploma (GED equivalent) required. Degree in Information
Technology or related curriculum preferred. Certified Information Security
Manager (CISM), and/or Certified Information Systems Security Professional
(CISSP) certifications desired. Cisco Certified Networking Associate (CCNA),
and/or Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) certifications desired.
Training in ITIL/IT Service Management processes is desired.

 **Demonstrated Abilities:**

  * Familiarity with NIST 800-53, PCI and CIS Controls Frameworks.
  * Experience administrating and managing firewall technologies such as Palo Alto, Cisco, and Checkpoint.
  * Experience administrating Virtual Private Networking solutions for third-party connectivity.
  * Experience administrating and managing Cisco Systems routing and switching technologies.
  * Experience or equivalent certification with Azure Networking and Firewalling concepts.
  * Experience with Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) technologies.
  * Experience managing and deploying WAN technologies based on standard routing protocols.
  * Experience and/or familiarity with data loss prevention technologies, intrusion detection/prevention platforms, vulnerability scanning systems, secure email gateways, and other similar security technologies.
  * Strong commitment to continuous education on networking concepts and cyber security education.
  * Able to identify, prioritize, and solve complex network-related problems.
  * Able to work in a fast paced complex and dynamic environment.
  * Poise under pressure and comfort with ambiguity.
  * Outstanding analytical, verbal and written skills.
  * Experience with writing system and process documentation.
  * Ability to remain highly adaptable in a growing organization.
  * Experience implementing security standards, policies and procedures.
  * In-depth knowledge of the OSI model.

Job Title: Red Team Sr. Engineer - Infrastructure Development Specialist (Full-Time Remote or Hybrid)
Job Description:
Location: 7000 Target Pkwy N, Brooklyn Park, Minnesota, United States, 55445

 **JOIN TARGET CYBERSECURITY AS A RED TEAM SENIOR ENGINEER - INFRASTRUCTURE
DEVELOPMENT SPECIALIST**

(Full-Time Remote or Hybrid)

About Us

Target is an iconic brand, a Fortune 50 company, and one of America’s leading
retailers. Target as a tech company? Absolutely. We’re the behind-the-scenes
powerhouse that fuels Target’s passion and commitment to cutting-edge
innovation. We anchor every facet of one of the world’s best-loved retailers
with a strong technology framework that relies on the latest tools and
technologies—and the brightest people—to deliver incredible value to guests
online and in stores. Target Technology Services is on a mission to offer the
systems, tools and support that guests and team members need and deserve. We
drive industry-leading technologies in support of every angle of the business,
and help ensure that Target operates smoothly, securely and reliably from the
inside out. Our high-performing teams balance independence with collaboration,
and we pride ourselves on being versatile, agile and creative. Use your
skills, experience, and talents as a member of a world-class cyber security
team!

Target brings our Vision and Purpose to Life through:

INCLUSIVITY

  * Value diverse voices and approaches
  * Be authentic and respectful
  * Create equitable experiences

CONNECTION

  * Build trusted relationships
  * Collaborate across business functions
  * Recognize and celebrate progress

DRIVE

  * Do what is right for Target, our team & guests
  * Deliver results that matter
  * Progress over perfection & continually learn

About Red Team

Target's Red Team uses adversary emulation to train defenders, and validate
the processes and technology defending the organization as part of Cyber
Security. We have a high level of transparency between teams. Organizational
improvement is our foremost goal. Our frequent and short operations are
supplemented with direct training, purple team work, and consulting within the
company on security risk. We rely heavily on infrastructure and automation.
Get a better sense of how our team functions! Watch "One Hundred Red Team
Operations a Year" on YouTube.

Red Team members regularly:

  * Consult on, design, and execute adversary emulation operations
  * Conduct research into real-world threat actor tactics, techniques, and procedures to develop proof-of-concept tools and playbooks
  * Bypass preventative and detective security controls to accomplish operational goals
  * Partner with the Cyber Security Incident Response Team and other stakeholders in the organization to identify improvement opportunities
  * Collaborate with Cyber Threat Intelligence, Detection, and Threat Hunting engineers and analysts on research
  * Work with non-security engineering teams to educate, and collaborate on operational objectives

Expect To:

  * Maintain secure infrastructure in cloud environments
  * Develop infrastructure code in Python, HCL (Terraform), and Salt
  * Maintain tools in Python, C#, Powershell, Go, or C
  * Manage work effectively in the team’s project management tools (Github/JIRA)
  * Respond to the quick-changing needs and priorities of the team
  * Support team members as end-users
  * Learn the techniques of Threat Actors and apply that lens to engineering work

About You

  * Has three years minimum experience in offensive security, defensive security, information technology infrastructure, and/or software development, or equivalent bachelor’s degree
  * Develops tools in one or more programming languages and frameworks
  * Demonstrates basic offensive security knowledge
  * Demonstrates a basic understanding of the impact of Red Team work on an organization and its customers
  * Prioritizes process improvement
  * Seeks out cross-team collaboration opportunities
  * Clearly and respectfully communicates technical issues in a training or mentorship setting
  * Resolves routine technical issues with minimal assistance
  * Builds strong commitment within a team to support the appropriate priorities
  * Demonstrates Agile project management principles within a team
  * Stays current on relevant technologies with self-directed learning

Desirable Skills:

  * Cloud infrastructure as code engineering with containers; Google Cloud, Terraform preferred
  * Strong Python, C#, Powershell, Go, or C project development
  * Solving difficult problems, and creatively subverting systems
  * Ability to analyze the tools and techniques of in-the-wild threat actors
  * Understands Threat Actor trends impacting organizational security

Job Title: Network Professional (Network System Engineer, Network Designer/Architect) - Entry to Senior Level - (Multiple Locations
Job Description:
The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal:
to protect our nation. The mission requires a strong offense and a steadfast
defense. The offense collects, processes and disseminates intelligence
information derived from foreign signals for intelligence and
counterintelligence purposes. The defense prevents adversaries from gaining
access to sensitive classified national security information. The National
Security Agency is a leader in deploying high-caliber solutions, continually
moving forward and contributing to industry leading technologies. We are
looking for results driven individuals that strive for excellence, enjoy the
challenges of a fast paced environment and the desire to make a difference. We
are looking for talented networking professionals to design, develop, deploy,
sustain and monitor state-of-the-art network solutions (WAN, CAN, LAN, DCN and
Satellite communications networks) that are deployed across NSA worldwide. We
are hiring entry to expert networking professionals with education and/or
experience in several of the following areas: \- Multi-vendor infrastructure
platforms (i.e., Cisco, Brocade, Juniper, Arista) \- Network encryption
devices and WAN accelerators \- Multi-vendor Layer 3 routing protocols (i.e.,
BGP, OSFP, EIGRP, IGRP, HSRP, VRRP) \- Virtual Private Networking (i.e., MPLS,
GRE, L2VPN, EVPN, Pseudowire, IPsec, MACSEC) \- Data center architectures and
converged networks \- Current networking trends, including commercial
implementations of Software Defined Networks (SDN) for both Data Center
Network and WAN applications \- Load balancing and Application Delivery
Controller technologies and implementations \- WAN architectures (i.e.,
Carrier Ethernet, Optical Fabrics (OTN), SONET) \- Network monitoring tools
(i.e., NetFlow Tracker, HP Network Node Manager, Cisco LMS, Cisco Call
Manager, Wireshark, and Splunk) \- Network Modeling (RiverBed/OPNet, NetSim)
\- Network Boundary (Next Generation Firewalls (Palo Alto, Cisco FIREPOWER),
IPSEC/SSL VPN Concentrators) \- Cross Domain Solutions (SafeNet MDeX System,
OWL Cyber Defense Cross Domain Solutions) \- Technical certifications (e.g.,
CCNA, CCNP, SEC+) Network Professionals are hired into positions directly
supporting a technical mission office or one of the different development
programs like the Information Technology Development Program (ITDP). This
program is a three-year full-time development program. The goal of the program
is to provide entry-level information technology specialists (that is,
individuals with degrees in computer science, information systems, information
technology, and related degrees and experience) the opportunity to learn the
various facets of the mission. These facets include: \- Development,
engineering and deployment of NSA mission systems \- Architecture,
development, building, and maintenance of NSA's fault-tolerant world-wide
information technology infrastructure \- High-performance computing system
development for cryptanalytic mission applications \- Human resources,
financial, and other business data warehouse storage and access \- Information
system security, engineering, testing, and evaluation. This position has a
Cyberspace Workforce Improvement Program (CWIP) requirement. Candidates
accepted to fill this position will be required to obtain a DoD 8570.01-M
approved certification within six (6) months of assignment. Interested parties
currently pursuing certification are also encouraged to apply. Additional
requirements may be placed against the selectee, based on requirements defined
within DoD 8140.01 and DoD 8570.01-M 'Information Assurance Workforce
Improvement Program'.

Job Summary

NSA is in search of top-notch cyber professionals with technical expertise and
driving desire at the forefront of their field. We have positions in
penetration testing, defensive operations, identifying cyber threats and
vulnerabilities and building defensive capabilities, designing, developing,
deploying, sustaining and monitoring state-of-the-art network solutions (WAN,
CAN, LAN, DCN and Satellite communications networks) that are deployed across
NSA worldwide. Help protect national security interests as part of the world's
most advanced team of cyber professionals!

Qualifications

Salary Range: $74,682 - $93,062 (Entry/Developmental) All locations *The
qualifications listed are the minimum acceptable to be considered for the
position. Salary offers are based on candidates' education level and years of
experience relevant to the position and also take into account information

position. Entry is with a Bachelor's degree and no experience. The following
may also be considered for individuals with in-depth experience that is
clearly related to the position: an Associate's degree plus 2 years of
relevant experience; or at least 18 semester hours of military
coursework/training in networking, computer science, or cyber topics plus 2
years of relevant experience. Degree must be in Network Engineering, Systems
Engineering, Information Technology or related field (e.g., General
Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science,
Computer Forensics, Cyber Security, Software Engineering, Information
Assurance, or Computer Security). Relevant experience must be in network or
system administration. Additional experience may be in one or more of the
following: computer or information systems design/development/installation,
programming, information/cyber/network security, vulnerability analysis,
penetration testing, computer forensics, information assurance or systems
engineering. If not credited toward education requirement, completion of
military training in a relevant area such as JCAC (Joint Cyber Analysis
course), Undergraduate Cyber Training (UCT), Network Warfare Bridge Course
(NWBC)/Intermediate Network Warfare Training (INWT), Cyber Defense Operations
will be considered towards the relevant experience requirement (i.e., 20-24
weeks course will count as 6 months of experience, 10-14 weeks will count as 3
months of experience).

 **  
Location:** Santa Cruz  
**Job ID:** 33648  
  
JOB POSTING

**INITIAL REVIEW DATE (IRD)**  
  
UC Santa Cruz staff jobs are posted until filled. Application materials

at the request of the hiring unit. Submit your materials before the IRD to
